List your name on the credit of the project document movie.
Download the movie, longer version. (of course your name on the credit!) 
$120 "Fan Meeting Pack" 
Invite you to the project briefing session and fan meeting in LA (August 10)! 
Present a Kazuhiko signed PRINTED Brochure "OpenSky 2013-2018" to the backer who came to the fan meeting. (For applicants: Write your name.)
And,
Invite you to the lecture presentation in LA (probably August 8 to 10)  and the exhibition in Chino Airport (probably August 15 to 18) !* Transportation expenses to the venue will not be included.

Keep inform you frequently update to tell how the OpenSky US Tour goes in the US. 
Send sincere thanks and PDF Brochure of the OpenSky Project "OpenSky 2013-2018".
List your name on the credit of the project document movie.
Download the movie, longer version. (of course your name on the credit!)* Includes a companion with you. For more companions, a consultation is necessary. 
$250  "Hangar Tour Pack" Special hangar tour guided by Kazuhiko Hachiya! Join me and our staffs and crews' deep and fun gathering at the hangar in Chino. Currently scheduled day: August 17 (Sat).* Transportations are not included.* Meal fee will be included.
And,
Invite you to the project briefing session and fan meeting in LA (probably on August 8 to 10)! 
Present a Kazuhiko signed PRINTED Brochure "OpenSky 2013-2018" to the backer who came to the fan meeting . (For applicants: Write your name.)
Invite you to the lecture presentation in LA (probably August 8~10)  and the exhibition in Chino Airport (probably August 15 to 18)!* Transportation expenses to the venue will not be included.

Keep inform you frequently update to tell how the OpenSky US Tour goes in the US. 
Send sincere thanks and PDF Brochure of the OpenSky Project "OpenSky 2013-2018".
List your name on the credit of the project document movie.
Download the movie, longer version. (of course your name on the credit!)* Includes a companion with you. For more companions, a consultation is necessary. 
$800  "Art Work Pack" From the 5 photos taken at the US tour, you can select one of your favorite photos and we frame it for you for delivery. The photo is 10 X 12 inch, Digital C Print. Each photo limited released only  10edition. The frame is: W337 × H387 × D14 mm. It will be printed and shipped from Japan after the US tour finished.* Shipping expense will not be included. OpenSky US Tour Approximate BudgetI have developed an action plan to put the US tour into practice last year. And at the beginning of the year, I calculated the approximate budget. The estimated total cost of the project is approximately 9 million yen (about $82K).The significant portion of the cost is a transportation fee of the aircraft (round trip to Japan and domestic transportation in the US), travel expenses, and accommodation expenses.The funds collected by Indiegogo are to be used for transportation of the airplane to California, travel and accommodation of the staff in California, costs for lectures and exhibitions in LA and Chino, flight test-related expenses, video and photo production costs, etc. I would like to share this project with many people in Japan and the US and make it a rewarding one for each of you...!<OpenSky US Tour Event Related Budget in California (USD)>
Transportation Fee: from Wisconsin to California $10,350
Transportation Fee: from Chino Airport to Corona Airport $1,200
Air Travel Expenses of The Staff x2: from ATW to LAX $520
Accommodation of The Staff (25 days of 8/6 to 8/31) $4,500
Lecture-Related Expenses in LA (inc. preparation) $800
Exhibition-Related Expenses in Chino (inc. preparation) $1,000
Fuel and Insurance Fee of The Airplane  $900
Renting Hangars $2,960
Video Production Fee $1,500
Photo Shooting Fee $1,000
Kickstarter's Reward Handling Cost $1,000
Total 25,730 USD
Crowdfunding and Its Management Members
Kazuhiko Hachiya, a person in charge of the project, will be responsible for the contents and the whole the crowdfunding, but Kickstarter's updating and communication with YOU will be mainly conducted by Gamme Takiguchi, the collaborator of the project.  It's me in 2006! At that time, the airplane didn't have an engine, so we had to pull it with strong rubber rope to make it float in the air. Still, I remember the excitement when the airplane I pulled was flying in the sky, with Mt. Fuji in the clear sky. Again, fly M-02J, this time in the US sky!!!  (Gamme Takiguchi )  Risks & ChallengesCurrently, our airplane is in transit by ship. We are considering that there is a risk of delays in customs clearance in the US customs inspection, etc., but it is assumed that the possibility of not being in time for the exhibition is low because there is enough transportation schedule to offset the risk. Also, there is a possibility that an accident or damage may occur during container (M-02J is in it) transportation, but we think that it is unlikely to happen.About flight testing, our airplane belongs to the Ultralight category in the US Aviation Act, that means in principle it can be flown in the US sky as a "Federal Aviation Regulation Part 103-Ultralight Vehicles" without FAA (Federal Aviation Administration) permission. To make it sure, we are asking the FAA about it while getting the cooperation of EAA.In any case, flight tests should only be performed in a safe environment and suitable weather, with utmost care to avoid accidents. At last...Thank you for reading through to the end. I would like to get your help, make the US tour a success, and let more people see M-02J...!!!


 

Reference: OpenSky web article (in English)

M-02J Spec. http://www.petworks.co.jp/opensky/

Popular Science http://pops.ci/SJDX31

Mainichi News http://mainichi.jp/english/articles/20160805/p2...

popular mechanics http://www.popularmechanics.com/flight/a22207/t...

YouTube 15 COOL VEHICLES AND PERSONAL TRANSPORT MACHINES https://youtu.be/NpQpm85CXIU

story:
Know Your Crazy

Know Your Crazy is an art book made for women, by women. It features mixed media art created by Vivienne Boucherat, a visual artist and musician from London, and was brought to life by Cindy daSilva, an artist manager out of New Jersey, and Rene Harbison, who heads up a production and consulting firm in Austin, Texas.

We all have our own ‘crazy’, and we each internalize in our own way.  We’ve made art come to life using Vivienne’s own little heady, mad women and we have presented it hopefully in a way that each one of you can relate to. Our intent was to make ‘crazy’ less crazy. We hope you’ll share with your friends and that you’ll have some fun, share a few laughs and perhaps shed a couple of tears, but most importantly know you are not alone. For all of our differences, we are all very much the same. 

We decided to crowdfund Know Your Crazy so that numerous women could be a part of our project! By backing our project, you will have the opportunity to experience some, if not all of these wonderful perks!

  • We are recreating the 1972 Rock anthem "Hold Your Head Up", originally by Argent, to serve as the soundtrack for our project.  You can be featured in our women’s movement recording and/or video for “Hold Your Head Up - (Almost) A cappella Version."  (Diamond and Platinum tiers only)

    • Did you know the lyrics are actually "Hold your head up, woman"? We didn't think so ? But Vivienne knows because she is married to the songwriter!  Her husband Chris White was the original bass player for 1960s British Invasion legends, The Zombies, and has countless credits to his name as a songwriter and producer, including the beloved Zombies classic "This Will Be Our Year" (heard in pivotal emotional scenes on TV shows like "Schitt's Creek", "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" and "Mad Men").  Chris wrote "Hold Your Head Up" for and about women, which is why he's disappointed so many fans misquote the lyrics.  Our (Almost) A cappella Version will set the record straight!

      • Audio - A clip of your vocals (at least 10 seconds) which will be recorded in a professional recording studio (limit to 30 minutes at the studio) will be included on our “Hold Your Head Up - Almost A Cappella Version.” Get dressed up, go to a professional recording studio, where a talented engineer/producer will help you sound your best! You'll also have a one-on-one Zoom chat with Viv beforehand to go over the available parts. She will help you pick out what works best for your voice, and prepare you for your session!

      • Video - Sing, dance, hold up a sign that says WOMAN! Those are just a few of the things you can do within our "Hold Your Head Up - Almost A cappella Version" video that will be on YouTube for all the world to see! Be a part of our women's movement and get ready for your closeup! ?

 

  • Will be guaranteed attendance of our Fireside Zoom Chat + Q & A with Vivienne Boucherat, Cindy daSilva, and Rene Harbison (date TBD) (Silver through Diamond tiers only)

 

  • Will receive one of our first edition box sets (out of 500) which includes
    • (59) 8" x 10", museum quality, art reproductions, by Vivienne Boucherat
    • A copy of the book ‘Know Your Crazy' 
    • This beautiful and sophisticated box will be impressive as a coffee table piece, but each of the 59 limited edition prints could also be framed individually to enhance your home environment, or make meaningful gifts for friends.  These 59 pieces of art are valued at $15,000 USD.
    • The dimensions of the box are, 11.75” x 8.75” x 2.25”
    • Your name will appear on a separate page that will be included in the box set 
    • (Bronze through Diamond tiers only)

 

  • Receive an exclusive t-shirt complete with the 'Know Your Crazy' cover art design on the front
    • Available Small-3XL (3XL only available for unisex crew)
    • Shirt styles available: unisex crew, ladies loose crew, ladies fitted crew
  • Receive an exclusive tote bag
    • A custom, cotton canvas tote bag complete with the 'Know Your Crazy' cover art design on the front
    • At 19 x 15 x 5” it’s a perfect size to toss in your reading or work materials and even a small laptop or iPad. And because it's 100% cotton and completely washable, you could also throw in your yoga pants and a T and head out to a class after a long day. Best of all, the ‘Bad Hair Day’ image is sure to stir up a conversation or two along the way. 
  • ALL ORDERS INCLUDE A COPY OF 'Know Your ‘Crazy’, a collection of Vivienne Boucherat art prints; her little mad women as she calls them. The art externalizes the Artists’ own internal ‘crazy’.
    • The 5x7” PUR bound book is produced on museum quality, archival paper. Though small in size this little book is huge in content! We know it will be a nice edition to any art collection or book collection that you may already own. 
  • 10% from every purchase will be donated to the 501c3 non-profit charity Know Your Worth

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need your help raising $50,000. Your contribution will help cover the costs for:
    • Manufacturing the book, box set, t-shirt, and tote bag
    • Covering production costs for the “Hold Your Head Up - A cappella Version" song and music video
    • Funding Know Your Worth

    • You get to be a part of a unique project and movement created for Women by Women

 

The Impact

  • Know Your Worth is a 501c3 nonprofit specifically designed to help talented women who can't afford to go to art or music school to achieve their goals. By contributing to our project, you will be able to make someone's dream come true. 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • We will ship all US packages via USPS Priority Mail 3 days in December 2020
  • For orders outside the US, we will ship via USPS International in December 2020
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, 10% of proceeds will still go to Know Your Worth. We will still fulfill all orders.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're not able to contribute, you can still spread the word about Know Your Crazy with your friends and family! You can share:
    • This Indiegogo URL
    • Our website
    • "Like" our Facebook for updates and invite your friends: https://www.facebook.com/knowyourcrazybook

    • Follow us on Instagram! http://Instagram.com/knowyourcrazybook

story:
Art is most vibrant and interesting when you happen upon it in unexpected places like at the bus stop or while getting your haircut.

This multimedia work was developed with that spirit in mind. Part of the project takes the form of a newspaper that will be distributed free around Manhattan. There will also be a gallery show at a barber shop with a performance haircut at the opening reception.


The Opening Reception and Performance will be held on:

April 21st from 5:30-8:30pm
at CityLife Barbers

(9th ave, btwn 22nd st and 23rd st in Manhattan)


This collaborative work between ten artists has been in development for over a year and a half. It consists of a newspaper, a website, a video, a performance piece, photographs, stories and drawings that all explore the line between the subject, the artist and the viewer, within a work of portraiture. To view some of the content of the work please visit onportraiture.com

Artist List: Pamela Bingcang, Mike Darby, Dan Funderburgh, Kristen Kendrick, David Lipp, Ken Morton, Ben Peterson, Austin Sakong, Sara Sowers, Travis Simon


By contributing to this project you will help put something exciting into the everyday life of the city. The money raised will go towards printing fees and other costs related to putting together the gallery show and opening reception.

If think it is interesting project please drop us a line and comment on the project and let others know about the campaign. Any help is greatly appreciated and we look forward to seeing you at the opening!

-----------

Curators note: As a designer and artist I develop collaborative art projects that address art in pubic in different ways. A recent successful project, Wearing Whitman's Words, brought limited edition t-shirt designs from nine artists to the walls of a gallery in Red Hook. I was able to give t-shirts of the work to everyone who came to the opening through fund-raising and in-kind donation.

story:
Spray Paint and Whiskey 

 

I’m Mowgli and I’m a Vegas-based Street Artist. I recently won my first gallery show in a Facebook ‘Like’ Contest at the Amanda Harris Gallery of Contemporary Art, set to open on February 1st during the Gallery’s monthly First Friday event.  To make the show great and memorable, I need your help.

The space has five walls of varying dimensions that I need to plaster with murals, portraits and other artworks. But as an emerging artist, I haven’t quit my day job, so time and money are not on my side. The prices for materials for the show come with a hefty price tag. Due to the nature of my art, printing and canvas eat up my income before I can even begin the painting process. In my budget listed below, you’ll see a very general breakdown of costs I’ve come up with for what I need to make the show awesome. This is where you come in.

This campaign will help me focus on the costs of making the event successful aside from my art, and  would save me from having to worry about funding for both. My plans for the show include hiring a live DJ, having cocktails available, T-shirts for sale, and food trucks on site. With your help, I’ll be able to make my first gallery show everything it should be, and I’m sure the event will be a huge success.

 

WHY SHOULD YOU HELP?

That’s a great question. The answer is because I’m awesome. JUST KIDDING!

My personal goal is to donate a portion of the proceeds from my gallery sales to the Special Olympics. I want to have as much work up as possible to sell for their benefit. I used to be a regular volunteer when I lived back east and admire the organization and I’d love to be able to continue contributing to the organization’s cause through my art.

Thanks for reading!  Chip in by filling in your desired donation in the box in the top right.

 

WHERE WILL MY MONEY GO?

I've prepared an itemized budget of what I will require to make the gallery show as great as I imagine it to be...

ITEMIZED BUDGET:

Canvas (various sizes)          $400
Spray Paint                          $100
Plywood (various sizes)         $200
Paper for Stencils (110lb)      $50
Printing (mural size)             $200
Adhesive (tape, 3M strips)     $30
Mask Filters                         $15
Exacto Blades                      $5

TOTAL                                 $1000

story: Honolulu Arts Beat is Hawaii’s source for online arts community news and features. Since beginning in May of 2009 on Oahu, Arts Beat has expanded readership and voluntary contributors to include all the major islands of Hawaii. Arts Beat does not charge for announcements about local arts activity, but currently gets funding exclusively from on line ad providers such as Google and others. This plan has provided minimal funding (about $110 to date) while Arts Beat continues to run a large deficit (somewhere above $8,000 to date) assumed by its founders Ray and Julia Pace. Arts Beat is an independent voice by the arts community, for the arts community. With help we would like to see it grow and succeed. Check out our website at http://www.honoluluartsbeat.com

story:
What

The ArtWalk is an independent project to promote art, environmental awareness and community on the Garden Route.

The Artwalk consists of 10 large outdoor sculptural installations, made from recycled waste materials, that visitors and locals can enjoy viewing in the gardens of timberlake. The installations are made by local communities under the guidance of local artists.

Art + Environment + Community = ArtWalk

Background

The ArtWalk is the natural progression of the community and environmental experience of timberlake and the community World Cup decor project on Thesen Island, managed by Artwalk co-ordinators Melissa Daitz and Bruce Adams. 

The Garden Route relies on tourism for its livelihood, but is the natural beauty of the Garden Route being used sustainably and is tourism uplifting all communities? Local community projects exist in the towns of George, Sedgefield, and Knysna with most producing arts and crafts in an attempt to sustain their important activities. Yet many of these projects remain unknown and receive little support. The ArtWalk aims to change this.

Why

Your contribution to the ArtWalk project will help the Garden Route come together to create around Art and the Environment, and help community projects and local artists gain exposure and increase their earnings potential.

The ArtWalk builds a hub that brings different people together, creates something beautiful from waste, showcases local creativity, highlights environmental challenges and provides much needed involvement and exposure for local artists and community projects.

Each sculpture spotlights an environmental challange...Stimulating conversation and education about the Environment.

Installations and components are made by local communities under the guidance of local artists... Developing Art and design on the Garden Route.

If you are a visitor or plan to visit the Garden Route, this is your opportunity to give back in a creative way.

The Installations

We have raised funds for the first four outdoor sculptures and we are appealing for assistance to raise sponsorships and donations for the remaining six installations to realize the vision of the ArtWalk...

5. PLASTIC IN THE SEA - Drawing the viewers attention to the amount of plastic in the oceans and how it affects all those who live in and around it.

6. STOP THE GROWTH OF WASTE - A visual demonstration of the potential growth in landfill sites if nothing is done to reverse the current trends.

7. CARBON FOOTPRINT - Natural solutions to help reduce the carbon footprint of new development.

8. FRAGILITY OF THE PLANET - A thin green line, which denotes the fine line that separtates living sustainably from living in a way that is destructive to our planet.

9. WATER WISE - Water conservation and the statement of a waterless garden.

10. CONSUMERISM - The power that the consumer can
bring to bear when they act with awareness.

Participate

ArtWalk is looking for sponsorship and donations to commission artists and local communities to create the six sculptural installations. 

Funding of $2000 will create one unique sculpture.

Funds raised are used to commission local artists and existing community projects to conceptualize and construct the sculptural installations. 

Main sponsors of a specific sculpture will have their logo or details incorporated into the installation.

All donors will have their names listed on the welcoming ArtWalk plaque that will greet visitors at the start of the ArtWalk, and on the ArtWalk map that will guide visitors to the installations, and be distributed as a brochure. 

If only part of the $2000 is raised and the amount is insufficient to create an entire installation, the funds will be donated to the community projects invoived. 

Impact

It is possible to participate together to building something beautiful out of waste, raise awareness for the environment, and support the creative work of local artists and communities on the Garden Route. 

As a visitor to the Garden Route your daily spend goes into the local economies of the small towns on the Garden Route. However, the amount of your spend that reaches the poorest communities is not enough to build healthy community, and provides few direct income earning opportunities for these communities. With your help the ArtWalk can break down barriers by bringing people together in a way that creates opportunity for local artists and communities on the Garden Route.

The World Cup decoration project, managed by Melissa Daitz and Bruce Adams, commissioned individuals from the Thembalethu township in Knysna to create 45,000 plastic "flowers" that were assembled into giant soccer decorations on Thesen Island and Memorial Square in Knysna. Visitors were still taking photographs of the decorations two years later. The ArtWalk is an evolution of this successful community project, and aims to create a central Garden Route project, so that more communities on the Garden Route can benefit. 

Community projects that stand to benefit:

- Libere foundation in George.
- George Child Welfare and Sikelela Skills Development Centre in George.
- Kleinkranz Childcare and Youth Development Centre in Kleinkrantz/Wilderness, Kleinkranz. 
- Masithandane in Sedgefield.
- Unemployed women from Tembalethu.

Other organizations that are taking part:

- Hilland Associates Environmental Consultants.
- Knysna Tourism.
- Seda Eden Branch.
- South Magazine.
- Dekro paints.
- The Edge Community Newspaper.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially please consider helping us to get the word out by sharing this campaign or liking the ArtWalk page on facebook.

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
What
The ArtWalk is an independent project to promote art, environmental awareness and community on the Garden Route.
The Artwalk consists of 10 large outdoor sculptural installations, made from recycled waste materials, that visitors and locals can enjoy viewing in the gardens of timberlake. The installations are made by local communities under the guidance of local artists.
Art + Environment + Community = ArtWalk
Background
The ArtWalk is the natural progression of the community and environmental experience of timberlake and the community World Cup decor project on Thesen Island, managed by Artwalk co-ordinators Melissa Daitz and Bruce Adams. 
The Garden Route relies on tourism for its livelihood, but is the natural beauty of the Garden Route being used sustainably and is tourism uplifting all communities? Local community projects exist in the towns of George, Sedgefield, and Knysna with most producing arts and crafts in an attempt to sustain their important activities. Yet many of these projects remain unknown and receive little support. The ArtWalk aims to change this.
Why
Your contribution to the ArtWalk project will help the Garden Route come together to create around Art and the Environment, and help community projects and local artists gain exposure and increase their earnings potential.
The ArtWalk builds a hub that brings different people together, creates something beautiful from waste, showcases local creativity, highlights environmental challenges and provides much needed involvement and exposure for local artists and community projects.
Each sculpture spotlights an environmental challange...Stimulating conversation and education about the Environment.
Installations and components are made by local communities under the guidance of local artists... Developing Art and design on the Garden Route.
If you are a visitor or plan to visit the Garden Route, this is your opportunity to give back in a creative way.


The Installations
We have raised funds for the first four outdoor sculptures and we are appealing for assistance to raise sponsorships and donations for the remaining six installations to realize the vision of the ArtWalk...
5. PLASTIC IN THE SEA - Drawing the viewers attention to the amount of plastic in the oceans and how it affects all those who live in and around it.
6. STOP THE GROWTH OF WASTE - A visual demonstration of the potential growth in landfill sites if nothing is done to reverse the current trends.
7. CARBON FOOTPRINT - Natural solutions to help reduce the carbon footprint of new development.
8. FRAGILITY OF THE PLANET - A thin green line, which denotes the fine line that separtates living sustainably from living in a way that is destructive to our planet.
9. WATER WISE - Water conservation and the statement of a waterless garden.
10. CONSUMERISM - The power that the consumer canbring to bear when they act with awareness.
Participate
ArtWalk is looking for sponsorship and donations to commission artists and local communities to create the six sculptural installations. 
Funding of $2000 will create one unique sculpture.
Funds raised are used to commission local artists and existing community projects to conceptualize and construct the sculptural installations. 
Main sponsors of a specific sculpture will have their logo or details incorporated into the installation.
All donors will have their names listed on the welcoming ArtWalk plaque that will greet visitors at the start of the ArtWalk, and on the ArtWalk map that will guide visitors to the installations, and be distributed as a brochure. 
If only part of the $2000 is raised and the amount is insufficient to create an entire installation, the funds will be donated to the community projects invoived. 


Impact
It is possible to participate together to building something beautiful out of waste, raise awareness for the environment, and support the creative work of local artists and communities on the Garden Route. 
As a visitor to the Garden Route your daily spend goes into the local economies of the small towns on the Garden Route. However, the amount of your spend that reaches the poorest communities is not enough to build healthy community, and provides few direct income earning opportunities for these communities. With your help the ArtWalk can break down barriers by bringing people together in a way that creates opportunity for local artists and communities on the Garden Route.
The World Cup decoration project, managed by Melissa Daitz and Bruce Adams, commissioned individuals from the Thembalethu township in Knysna to create 45,000 plastic "flowers" that were assembled into giant soccer decorations on Thesen Island and Memorial Square in Knysna. Visitors were still taking photographs of the decorations two years later. The ArtWalk is an evolution of this successful community project, and aims to create a central Garden Route project, so that more communities on the Garden Route can benefit. 
Community projects that stand to benefit:
- Libere foundation in George.- George Child Welfare and Sikelela Skills Development Centre in George.- Kleinkranz Childcare and Youth Development Centre in Kleinkrantz/Wilderness, Kleinkranz. - Masithandane in Sedgefield.- Unemployed women from Tembalethu.
Other organizations that are taking part:
- Hilland Associates Environmental Consultants.- Knysna Tourism.- Seda Eden Branch.- South Magazine.- Dekro paints.- The Edge Community Newspaper.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute financially please consider helping us to get the word out by sharing this campaign or liking the ArtWalk page on facebook.
Thank you for your support!

story:
Short Summary

I want make 30 gigantic (at least 150,000 pixel width) Panoramas of Sicilian sceneries, architectures, landscapes and arts. The panoramas will be available on the internet for everybody to watch and discover Sicily. Funders will have access to printing and file downloading and can ask for a specific location to be photographed.   

The Panoramas will be hosted on Gigapan.com and from there you can order a print of the desired size to be shipped to your address. Easy.

 

Doing this kind of gigantic images requires skills and dedicated hardware which I own since I used the same methods for my work in fine art technical documentation. This is my blog, Cultural Heritage Science Open Source. 

I was born and raised in Sicily. Studied there, took, my degree and PhD in Physics and as many of my colleagues I went abroad looking for opportunities. There are very few of them in Sicily, especially if you hold a high educational degree. I worked most of the time in US, as a “Cultural Heritage Scientist”, I do scientific examination of works of art for conservation and authentication. Last Fall I decided I wanted to go back home in Sicily and with the little money I saved I started up my own private business. It’s tough and a lot of traveling, since my customers are all across Europe, but when I get back home, I see my family and all that effort makes sense.

Sometimes ago I was reading a local newspaper “La Sicilia” and I found that one big page was used for a touristic ads about visiting Sicily.  Why the Sicilian Regional Tourism Office spends money to put an ads on a local newspaper read only by Sicilians? We want others around the world to know about Sicily, no?

I’m now based in Sicily. Most of my university colleagues, the most brilliant, actually, left the Country and found highly paid positions abroad. There is little left here. Most of the best brains are gone and Hope is dwindling.

I want to be proud of my Country, and I want innovative, effective and low-cost tools to show its beauty. I already use Panoramic HDR (High Dynamic Range) photography for paintings and fine arts documentation. Panoramic photography is a method to produce gigantic photographs while HDR (High Dynamic Range) allows to create photos with true colors, as those seen by your eyes.

 

What I  Need & What You Get

  • Approximately $ 200 will go to Indiegogo, Paypal, etc fees
  • Approximately $ 3000 will go to pay for traveling expenses (driving with my car through Sicily) on my weekends to visit the areas for the panoramas. I’ll use roughly $ 100 per panorama, which will deliver at least 30 panoramas.

While the panoramas would be online for everybody to watch and explore, only funders ($20) will be allowed to print them through Gigapan.com printing service. This is an example.  Funders for $100 can also get the original file to download and funders for $200 can ask for a panorama to be taken from a specific place.

 

The project will start whatever the funding, starting with a little number of panoramas.  

The Impact

Sicily is a land of contrasts. Social contrasts are well known. Less known are its sceneries colors and lights contrast. The sunlight strikes the land fearfully while shadows are pitch dark. This is Sicily sensorial experience. Though, until recently there was no way to render in photos this lights contrast. This is digital cameras limitation, where actually our eye is superior. The dynamic range of digital cameras is less than that of our eye. This means they can render details just in the bright areas or in the dark ones. The human eye is much more powerful in that sense. Our eye has a much wider dynamic range, so we can tell details simultaneously in bright sunlit areas and in the shadows. HDR Panoramas bring all this together. Sicily in true Colors! 

Panorams will be geolocated, so these Panoramas gallery is going to have an impact how travelers choose locations in Sicily.   

Other Ways You Can Help

I welcome suggestions for panoramas from Sicilians at home, Sicilians abroad or just Sicily enthusiasts!

Next Panoramas

Upcoming panoramas:

 

- Timpa di Acireale (from Fortezza del Tocco)

 

- Timpa di Acireale (from Fortezza del Tocco) INFRARED

 

- Mt Etna North and its coast  (from Castelmola)

 

- Taormina (from its Castello Saraceno )

 

- Isola delle Correnti (from "Captain" camping)

 

- Vendicari

- Pantalica

- Stretto di Messina (from Antinnammare)

- Valle del Bove (Mt. Etna)

 - .....

story:
Our Mission

Guts Gallery aims are to provide financial support and exhibition opportunities for artists less platformed within today’s contemporary art scene; our desire is to facilitate space and exposure for BAME artists, female artists, working-class artists, queer artists, and artists outside of London (bridging the North/South divide)

Through initiating relationships between established and emerging artists, we can create an inclusive and diverse arts community, with a dynamic and interesting creative working environment, to produce new structures that enable emerging artists to have the exposure they are often denied.

From the 16-19th May 2019, Guts Gallery is opening its doors for the first time, exhibiting works from renowned and emerging practitioners at Ugly Duck’s London Bridge event space. An extensive programme has been curated, with talks, tours and spoken word events taking place, to produce and uphold creative networks for artists often not afforded such opportunities. In partnership with the company, Ugly Duck, whose large scale studio complex is being offered, enabling artists, community groups and the public to come together in London’s busy centre.

Running such a large exhibition is costly; your support is invaluable! By giving to  Guts Gallery’s opening exhibition you’ll be able to help us accomplish our goal of facilitating the success of emerging artists whose adversity often blocks their vital inclusion.  Our aim is to cultivate an art scene here in London that supports and promotes artists of low income backgrounds, as well as all artists of colour, sexual orientations and gender identities, to collectively demonstrate the cultural wealth, quality and importance of grassroots galleries and encourage new audiences from outside of London to enrich nation networks.

    The Purpose 

    The distribution of wealth within the arts operates on a model which mirrors that of wider social austerity; it disproportionately benefits people who do not experience racial oppression, gender or class discriminations. In order to facilitate the success of struggling artists, individuals in the art world and institutions who are financially and creatively influential need to recognise and discuss the lack of resources available to a large number of artists who are systematically disadvantaged and unheard.

    What We Need

    Van hire

    This will help any artists who are struggling financially to transport their work to and from the gallery; many artists turn down exhibition opportunities because of the financial difficulties regarding transportation.

    Maintenance tools and equipment

    Tools and equipment for exhibition installs are extremely expensive. However, once we have these, we will be equipped both for our opening show and for future exhibitions.

    Staff wage

    We endeavour to pay Guts Gallery’s fantastic, hard-working staff, who are all juggling their commitment to Guts Gallery with their exhausting work schedules and studies. Many larger galleries do not pay their staff and rely on volunteers; we want to prove that, even as a small gallery, it is entirely feasible and fair to do so...

    Marketing and the Exhibition Night

    Marketing is vital in the run-up to an exhibition. We plan on designing tote bags, posters, stickers and a magazine in order to promote our inaugural event, seeking to create as much momentum and attention for the show, allowing the best possible platform on which to spread the Guts Gallery ethos.

    For the exhibition evening itself, we are in need of benches, a PA system, debit/credit card readers and artist labels.

    What You Will Get

    Any donations over £100: An honorary mention on the Guts Gallery website and all social media platforms.

    The Impact

    Why should you donate to Guts Gallery?

    • You have the power to make an impact on the careers of emerging artists;.
    • You will be part of a movement that challenges inequality in the art world;
    • You will improve engagement and dialogue between better-known artists and those still looking to establish a voice;
    • You will be vital in making art more accessible to everyone;
    • You could spur less privileged, younger artists on, showing them they have a place;
    • You will support the future and success of smaller art galleries, especially at a time in which many small, not-for-profit venues are being closed down;
    • You will be part of an ever-expanding grassroots network, with a focus on promoting diverse artists.

    About the Founder?

    Ellie Pennick is the founder of Guts Gallery. She is a queer, working-class artist from North Yorkshire. After leaving university in the Summer of 2017, she was accepted onto a Sculpture Masters course at the Royal College of Art. However, due to limited funds, she was unable to study there.

    This spurred her on to think about how she could create a business venture that could benefit other struggling artists like herself. Many people are scared to speak out about inequality in the art world, often in fear of their own precarious positions being compromised. Pennick, through the creation of Guts Gallery, wanted a gallery that could speak out, a gallery with the guts to protest.

    Who Do We Support And Why?

    // FEMALE ARTISTS

    One of the factors that have lead to the formation of the Gallery has been a drive to close the gender pay gap within the art world. According to a report published by the Freelands Foundation, throughout 2017 only 28% of artists represented by major commercial galleries in London were women, a fall from 29% the previous year. Gender disparity is a problem that thrives in most creative industries, and it is our goal that women occupy an equal space in the industry and percentages like these see an increase. Equal representation is just one aspect of gender disparity in the art world, and equal pay is another. Finding creative and innovative solutions to as broad a social issue as equality is something that we hope to incorporate into the running of the gallery.  

    // WORKING CLASS ARTISTS

    It is commonly known that the art world has historically been, and continues to be, dominated by the privileged elite. The art world’s approach to working-class artists is one which currently makes achieving success in the field considerably harder than it is for people of middle-class or financially privileged backgrounds. This is a structure that Guts Gallery will challenge. Providing a creative platform for those without financial privilege on their side is not only essential to the diversification of the art world, but also is a crucial part of opening up much-needed dialogues on social issues and current working-class problems.

    Financial support and recognition of working-class artists are in due order. GQ recently published an article entitled ‘When will we give working-class creatives the support they deserve?' in which the life and artistic career of Laura Footes is explored. Footes bluntly described how she got to her position in the industry by 'building an identity based on fakeness' - creating an image that fits well into the art frame and alternative persona. The need to build different personas and identities in order to become a successful artist is not an idea that should exist. Instead, we should shape the frame to be more open, welcoming and understanding working-class artists and their refreshing opinions.

    // ARTISTS OUTSIDE OF LONDON // Bridging The North-South Divide

    Another way in which Guts intends to diversify the art world is by bridging the gap between the North and South of the UK. The London art scene is thriving, with lots of emerging artists getting representation and recognition. However, the physical and ideological distance between the North and South can mean that those who are thriving in the North don’t get the chance to be represented in the South, especially within London's artistic circles. Not only is this a great shame, it also seems creatively essential that artists whose work is appreciated and recognised in the North get the funding and opportunities to be recognised in the South too. Large amounts of working class artists establish themselves in the North and then find transferring or taking up artistic space elsewhere very difficult to do effectively. Appropriate funding would act as a necessary vector to move both art and artists across this geographical divide.  In a 2017 article in The Guardian, it was estimated that £700m worth of funding would be needed to completely bridge the artistic divide between the North and London. As it stands, the divide negatively impacts the UK’s cultural and creative progression. To even begin to bridge this vast gap is not only a step forward with regards to equal funding distribution but also a step forward with regards to the increased representation of working-class art and artists in the capital.

    // BAME (Black, Asian + Minority Ethnic) ARTISTS

    One of the most common debates with regards to the art world and its shortcomings in relation to equal artistic representation is the absence of BAME artists, especially in large established gallery spaces. In a 2017 Art-Net report, it was found that 80% of artists in NYC’s top galleries were white.

    Although this figure stands with regards to New York art galleries, the story is much the same in London. Social mobility for BAME artists is something that is being talked about, but more can be done in order to give these artists the appropriate platform to showcase their work and thrive. If large art galleries are failing with regards to BAME representation with no excuse and the most amount of funding, then it is essential that smaller independent galleries, like Guts, recognise this negative trend of whiteness within the gallery space, and do as much as possible to change this fact. Equal representation and apt social change can begin on an independent level that will then, hopefully, be further echoed by larger galleries and art establishments.

    // QUEER ARTISTS

    Another area of the art industry’s shortcomings that we would like to focus on, and continue to improve through the gallery, is the representation of queer artists. On a significantly more positive note, queer visibility in art is something that is currently being boosted, with a host of queer artistic talent gaining significant recognition. However, as with any area of progression, a further positive incline in visibility is necessary. Increased recognition, and creating a further safe artistic space for queer artists to experiment and exhibit, is another goal of Guts.

     

    // ARTISTS ON A LOW INCOME

    London is currently an expensive place to live with the high costs of living.  Artists continue to migrate away from London; popular alternatives include Margate, Ramsgate, Southend and Nottingham. Others have gone farther afield, to places such as Berlin - places that promise lower rents and less creative prohibition. The continuing hardships of London living create hostile working conditions for young people who subsequently remove themselves from their creative communities. Artists, disenfranchised by broken promises and unfeasible working conditions, opt to leave or are forced to leave. Support systems disintegrate after studies in creative fields are completed, and creative potential seems to come up against an expiry date. Artists now face a choice between working full time to pay the rent, to cover loans, and to support families, and their creative work seems to either be slotted into exhausting schedules, performed for free or totally abandoned.

    The uncertainty of a post-Brexit art world only adds to the artist's adversity. According to the Arts Council, arts and culture contribute about £11.8bn to the UK economy, but the majority of artists earn less than £10,000 a year. The potential loss of the creative Europe programme funding could also prove detrimental to the industry. While there have not been any immediate changes and announcements regarding operators’ access to funding, the money may no longer be available once Britain leaves the Union, exacerbating what is already a tight financial situation and providing a major threat to the industry.

    Exhibiting Artists 

    Polly Morgan, Liam Fallon, Robert Cooper, Alexi Marshall, Lucy Neish, Sophie Vallance, Lucy Gregory, Bryden, Sola Olulode, Florence Hutchings, Billy Parker, Hannah Tilson, Valerie Savchits, Douglas Cantor, Tess Williams, Rosa Luetchford, Joe Holbrook, Ze Aya, Florence Sweeney, Mary Savva, Alfie Kungu, Rene Matić, Ruby Dickson and Jenny Beard.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
    • Share our events on your Social Media platforms;
    • Buy our publications, merchandise and all else; it helps towards production costs, plus could help us generate profits to reinvest;
    • Come to our events and bring your friends!

Providing a creative platform for those without financial privilege on their side is not only essential to the diversification of the art world, but also is a crucial part of opening up much-needed dialogues on social issues and current working-class problems.
Financial support and recognition of working-class artists are in due order. GQ recently published an article entitled ‘When will we give working-class creatives the support they deserve?' in which the life and artistic career of Laura Footes is explored. Footes bluntly described how she got to her position in the industry by 'building an identity based on fakeness' - creating an image that fits well into the art frame and alternative persona. The need to build different personas and identities in order to become a successful artist is not an idea that should exist. Instead, we should shape the frame to be more open, welcoming and understanding working-class artists and their refreshing opinions.
// ARTISTS OUTSIDE OF LONDON // Bridging The North-South Divide
Another way in which Guts intends to diversify the art world is by bridging the gap between the North and South of the UK. The London art scene is thriving, with lots of emerging artists getting representation and recognition. However, the physical and ideological distance between the North and South can mean that those who are thriving in the North don’t get the chance to be represented in the South, especially within London's artistic circles. Not only is this a great shame, it also seems creatively essential that artists whose work is appreciated and recognised in the North get the funding and opportunities to be recognised in the South too. Large amounts of working class artists establish themselves in the North and then find transferring or taking up artistic space elsewhere very difficult to do effectively. Appropriate funding would act as a necessary vector to move both art and artists across this geographical divide.  In a 2017 article in The Guardian, it was estimated that £700m worth of funding would be needed to completely bridge the artistic divide between the North and London. As it stands, the divide negatively impacts the UK’s cultural and creative progression. To even begin to bridge this vast gap is not only a step forward with regards to equal funding distribution but also a step forward with regards to the increased representation of working-class art and artists in the capital.
// BAME (Black, Asian + Minority Ethnic) ARTISTS
One of the most common debates with regards to the art world and its shortcomings in relation to equal artistic representation is the absence of BAME artists, especially in large established gallery spaces. In a 2017 Art-Net report, it was found that 80% of artists in NYC’s top galleries were white.
Although this figure stands with regards to New York art galleries, the story is much the same in London. Social mobility for BAME artists is something that is being talked about, but more can be done in order to give these artists the appropriate platform to showcase their work and thrive. If large art galleries are failing with regards to BAME representation with no excuse and the most amount of funding, then it is essential that smaller independent galleries, like Guts, recognise this negative trend of whiteness within the gallery space, and do as much as possible to change this fact. Equal representation and apt social change can begin on an independent level that will then, hopefully, be further echoed by larger galleries and art establishments.
// QUEER ARTISTS
Another area of the art industry’s shortcomings that we would like to focus on, and continue to improve through the gallery, is the representation of queer artists. On a significantly more positive note, queer visibility in art is something that is currently being boosted, with a host of queer artistic talent gaining significant recognition. However, as with any area of progression, a further positive incline in visibility is necessary. Increased recognition, and creating a further safe artistic space for queer artists to experiment and exhibit, is another goal of Guts. // ARTISTS ON A LOW INCOME
London is currently an expensive place to live with the high costs of living.  Artists continue to migrate away from London; popular alternatives include Margate, Ramsgate, Southend and Nottingham. Others have gone farther afield, to places such as Berlin - places that promise lower rents and less creative prohibition. The continuing hardships of London living create hostile working conditions for young people who subsequently remove themselves from their creative communities. Artists, disenfranchised by broken promises and unfeasible working conditions, opt to leave or are forced to leave. Support systems disintegrate after studies in creative fields are completed, and creative potential seems to come up against an expiry date. Artists now face a choice between working full time to pay the rent, to cover loans, and to support families, and their creative work seems to either be slotted into exhausting schedules, performed for free or totally abandoned.
The uncertainty of a post-Brexit art world only adds to the artist's adversity. According to the Arts Council, arts and culture contribute about £11.8bn to the UK economy, but the majority of artists earn less than £10,000 a year. The potential loss of the creative Europe programme funding could also prove detrimental to the industry. While there have not been any immediate changes and announcements regarding operators’ access to funding, the money may no longer be available once Britain leaves the Union, exacerbating what is already a tight financial situation and providing a major threat to the industry.
Exhibiting Artists 
Polly Morgan, Liam Fallon, Robert Cooper, Alexi Marshall, Lucy Neish, Sophie Vallance, Lucy Gregory, Bryden, Sola Olulode, Florence Hutchings, Billy Parker, Hannah Tilson, Valerie Savchits, Douglas Cantor, Tess Williams, Rosa Luetchford, Joe Holbrook, Ze Aya, Florence Sweeney, Mary Savva, Alfie Kungu, Rene Matić, Ruby Dickson and Jenny Beard.
Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Share our events on your Social Media platforms;
Buy our publications, merchandise and all else; it helps towards production costs, plus could help us generate profits to reinvest;
Come to our events and bring your friends!

story:
Art Car Construction Class Start Up!

Hi I’m Lisa Nigro and I’m trying to raise funds to purchase a used vehicle to turn in to an art car. The art car itself is going to be built as part of a class I’ll be teaching starting in January, a first for San Antonio.  Students in the class will help conceptualize and design the art car, and learn new skills, such as welding and plasma cutting. Together we will physically construct and fabricate the car during the class just in time to enter the world re-known, 29th Annual Houston Art Car Parade on Saturday April 9!

This isn’t my first art car.  I was the Creatress of one of the most influential art cars in America, the multi-vehicle and fire breathing Draka the Dragon. I’ve directed hundreds of volunteers on the construction of several other large-scale outdoor sculptures at Burning Man and other festivals across the US. I currently teach art throughout the San Antonio community.

Contributions by wonderful supporters such as yourself will fuel this unique and innovative art form, which has yet to be explored by San Antonians, to the city of San Antonio and Houston!

What We Need

$500 + a new battery + gasoline = This will allow me to purchase a Dodge van, generously being offered at a discounted price by Houston art car artist Joe Haden, which will then be the vehicle transformed by my class into an art car. The vehicle is currently located outside of Houston, so funds acquired will also assist in transporting this vehicle to San Antonio, as well as assist in travel expenses to and from the Houston Art Car Parade.

Here's the vehicle we'll be deconstructing and converting.

Support above and beyond our goal of $1000 will allow the art car team to purchase any additional materials which are not currently covered by class fees, such as steel or found objects, sculpting mediums such as fiberglass or Skratchworks, upholstery fabrics, and auto mechanic tools and maintenance supplies we may need for the ride and upkeep of the vehicle during Art Car Parade and beyond...

What You Get

A chance to be part of insuring San Antonio is represented by a fabulous rolling piece of art in the Art Car Parade, plus the perks listed. Each supporter will be recognized and listed on the vehicle.

The Impact

Help me bring San Antonio's creative talent to Houston! And awaken San Antonio to the delightful world of Art Car! It's symbiotic, let's explore it.

The class starts January 30. If you are interested in being involved as a student on this art car contact me for more details. Or if you would like to be part of the volunteer team as a volunteer and enjoy the parade in Houston.

    Challenges

    We have only 8 weeks, from start to finish, readying the art car for entry into the Parade. There's always a learning curve with a new project of this scale and mistakes may be made as the class experiments with new materials in a new genre. Mistakes usually add costs to a project, your contribution to this project can assist in providing a financial buffer and help to insure that this art car makes it to Art Car Parade 2016!

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help get the word out, I’m really excited about venturing into new territory and creating a unique collaborative artistic vision which will represent San Antonio. Please use the Indiegogo share tool or other social media to explain to others about Art Car and help us make this happen for our community.

      WE ASPIRE 2 INSPIRE San Antonio! So can U! Thanks for your support!

story:
If you've signed up for this on the day of the 28th, email mattleesgames (at) gmail dot com for the details!


***IMPORTANT!*** ONLY PURCHASE A HOT DATE IF YOU ALSO HAVE A TICKET FOR THE REGULAR FEATURES LIVE SHOW ON THE 28TH OF MARCH.

Buy a pre-show date with Gavin Murphy, as discussed on the Regular Features podcast. Please note that it is almost definitely a joke and you won't get any form of sexy sexy action. Seriously - he's a taken man. Please put it away, Roger.

  • All of the money raised will go to the Royal Marsden charity.
  • As part of the hot-hot date you will be bought a drink by Gav. NICE.
  • The date will last roughly an hour, and will start at 6pm sharp. What do you mean people don't organise dates like this normally? Of course they do.
  • The date will take place in a pub nearby, details will be provided.
  • The date may be awkward.
  • Things may be required.
  • It says we're expecting £500 but that's just silly and I had to write that in the box or it wouldn't let me use the site.

The Impact

  • Someone will have a lovely time.
  • Money will be raised for charity.

Risks & Challenges

  • Gav might be a nightmare.
  • Dating someone while they also date 12 other people may be complex.
  • It's very likely the events of this date will be used as part of the live show afterwards, and may cause long-term mental scars.

story:
What will happen...

“Time is an illusion” Albert Einstein

The TEMPO. MEMORIA: Daring to Dream Again project curated by Sergio Gomez (owner of Art NXT Level Project/33 Contemporary Gallery and curator at the Zhou B Art Center) presents a riveting exhibition exploring the themes of TIME and MEMORY from a variety of world perspectives. From cultural, political, psychological, religious, or personal view points, curator Gomez invited a selective group of international artists to visually articulate and interpret to their discretion ideas of time passing, memory, dreams and our personal perceptions on such concepts. This exhibition also includes a participatory element. Visitors to the exhibition will be invited to write a note about a personal memory and post it on a wall, creating a living work of collective memories.

The MIIT (Museo Internazionale Italia Arte) is a new museum located in the heart of the city of Turin, Italy in a fervent neighborhood of galleries, museums and foundations.

The exhibition will feature twenty-five extraordinary visual artists representing the US (Chicago, New York, Miami), Peru, Korea, Germany, Spain, Iran, Mexico, France and the Philippines. All the works have been exclusively created for this exhibition.

This international exhibition invites the viewer to an exploratory journey experiencing global interpretations of TIME and MEMORY while reflecting on their own personal emotions and memories.

ARTISTS:

ARX
Jason Brammer
Carol Brookes
Cesar Conde
Jennifer Cronin 
Orlando Diaz
Christine Forni
Jaime Foster
Laura Frazier
Victoria Fuller
Rodrigo Ghattas
Sergio Gomez
Mario Gonzalez Jr
Petronilla Hohenwarter
Sally Ko
Annesta Le
Ernesto Marenco
Luis Martin
Alejandro Mendoza
Avisheh Mohsenin
InJung Oh
Joyce Owens
Sarvin Saghighi
Jordan Scott 
Alba Soto


Why Becoming a VIP Partner

The MIIT Museum has provided the exhibition space, marketing campaign, local cultural support and other logistical assistance. However, the shipping costs and production of the book are two big undertakings. How big? Imagine shipping over 50 works of art overseas, documenting the process, and designing and printing the book documenting the exhibition.

Here is the cost break down:

Shipping (Round trip+customs fees+forms): $4,800
500 Color Catalogs: $2,200
Total Needed: $7,000

This is an amazing opportunity for you to be part of an international cultural art project and to be considered one of our VIP Partners in this journey. Here are some of the benefits of becoming a VIP Partner:

  • Follow our journey to and from Italy.
  • Be the first to get exclusive behind the scenes updates.
  • Your name will be documented as a VIP Partner in our limited edition catalog and dedicated website.
  • Get some amazing perks based on your support level.
  • As a partner, you are part of the story!


The Impact

The truth is, dialog and exchange among people of different cultures and backgrounds is very important and necessary. Tempo Memoria invites the viewer to ponder on these familiar experiences and respond with their own memories thus creating an interactive wall of memories.  Supporting cultural non-commercial projects is so important for the enrichment of humanity. Please consider supporting this project.


Corporate Donations

Corporate financial support will greatly assistant with the economic impact of the Turin, Italy exhibition. Company name and logo will be included on all promotional materials (virtual, social media and print) for donations of $500 or over.


Previous Exhibitions in Turin, Italy

In the Summer of 2014, The MIIT and 33 Contemporary Gallery collaborated in the production of four simultaneous individual exhibitions. This was the first Chicago exhibition at the recently founded MIIT Museum directed by Guido Folco. The exhibition established stronger cultural ties between the US and Italy.


In 2012, Sergio Gomez curated the first Chicago exhibition in Turin in collaboration with Italia Arte and Guido Folco titled Art+Energy+Future. The expo celebrated the Year of Sustainable Energy featuring over 30 Chicago artists from 33 Contemporary Gallery. A successful Indigogo crowdfunding campaign like this one, made it possible for amazing people like you to donate and make the exhibition possible.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us pread the love by sharing this campaign with a friend. Your support is greatly appreciated!!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, thank you for taking the time to read more about our project! This is a fundraiser for the soon to be 'Wondabubba and the Big Splash' hard cover book! Ever since I (Illustrator) was a child I have had the dream to make childrens books and to have them published for other kids to read. Finally I have a chance to publish one of my greatest co-creations yet 'Wondabubba and the Big Splash!' as a 32 + page fully illustrated story book. Originallly the project started as a multimedia presentation by Gary Giles (Author), the original mind behind the world of Wondabubba. He took this production as a one man show and presented it to schools and other functions through out the USA and this is an ongoing production. He commissioned me to illustrate his story and we commenced on a nine month long journey to completion! I am so excited to have this opportunity to inspire the next generation of young Creatives and have such a positive impact in this world! I have been entrusted with the task to have this book printed and I am so thrilled to finally see it realized!

What We Need & What You Get

Hear's the plan. The goal is set to $12,000 which will go enirely into printing what will be a minimum of 1000 copies to distribute around the world (we hope to print 1500). Ten percent will support the artist (me) while I spend the necessary time putting in the final touches, and even painting whole new sections of page spreads. Once the needed funds are aqcuired and all editing is done we will commence in printing. We want it to be affordable at a maximum of $20 per book, ideally less and this is factored into the expenses. Any remaining money will go towards getting the book out to all of you amazing co-creators! If we don't reach our goal we will still go to print if possible, otherwise we will start another campaign. The number one priority for us is the book! And we are dedicated to making it happen!

The Impact

This is an amazing project and many will benefit as the message of Wondabubba and the Big Splash is both timely and inspiring to behold, both in it's message and it's artistry. This is a book that will be remembered as one of the greatest childrens books of all time! <- (Words of the Author) 'Wondabubba and the Big Splash!' is a fun adventure story which teaches by simple example the power of friendship, cooperation and unselfishness. I feel it is a message we sorely need in these times.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! For those who are able to raise the funds through their own networks we will give the perks mentioned in that funding level. Contact me to become an official promoter! This is all about getting this amazing book published!

Like us on facebook ~ http://www.facebook.com/WondabubbaBookPublishing

Get a feel for the artist by visiting his page ~ http://www.james5d.com

A Word From the Author:

story:
I love writing. This is what I've been born to do, this is what I've always dreamed of doing. It's that one thing I feel I'm kind of good at, and that one thing that allows me to be at my best as a human being.

You know, when you're able to give something to others, to offer something to this world. To change the world, to build a new one.

But, unfortunately, book sales have been incredibly low this past months. I've been trying to offer discounts, e-book bundles, but still... it wasn't enough.

I took a part-time job as a waiter, but the job was part time only in terms of pay. I didn't have time to write, and this is, simply put, the worst kind of life for a writer.

So I quit.

I wanted to be able to write, I wanted to be able to blog as often as I used to, to be able to read other people's comments.

There are no perks to go with your donations. All you get is a big perk in case I reach my goal: a compilation of essays on art and writing that will be made available for free.

This is going to be my way of thanking you for your help, and my way to give people something back.

story:
My upcoming solo exhibition is scheduled for July 2014 at White Walls and Shooting Gallery in San Francisco.  This will be my second solo exhibition with White Walls.  Last year's show entitled, "Cellar Door" received warm reviews and recognition from press outlets such as Free People online, Refinery29, Live Fast Magazine and 7x7 Magazine to name a handful.  As I finalize my ideas for this upcoming exhibition, I work with a strong desire to progress forward and upward with my art and concepts.  Overall, my goal for the upcoming exhibition is to deliver to my audience (and hopefully new fans!) the same caliber of work and concept as they are used to seeing from me.  

ABOUT MY WORK: I am a multi-disciplined artist working in a variety of materials.  I enjoy combining materials in unexpected ways - various metals, paper, neon, wood and organic mediums come together to form a story. Through my work, I discuss a universal connection between everything and everyone on this planet as it relates to the universe outside of our world - it's all about the cosmos!  

I pay close attention to the elements of my materials.  For example, my work in paper consists of the element carbon; steel is iron and all of my neon signs use the noble gases.  I attempt to highlight this strict choice of materials and show a chronological story from the birthplace of these elements (the sun and the universe) to their experience here on earth and in my hands.  Through this process, I hope to teach people a new appreciation for the vast world outside our world.  View some example of my work in the "Gallery" tab above to see if you connect. 









MY PROJECT:  "The Golden Hour" is an exhibition entirely dedicated to the elemental life force and power of the sun (or all suns). More specifically, how suns creates light, life and almost everything in the universe.  This show will be my homage to a mother sun creating my own spirituality from this idea.  Most of my neon tubing will be filled with Helium (He pictured above) which is the second most abundant element in the Universe and the first element created by atomic fusion within a star (Hydrogen fuses to create Helium). Coincidentally, the color of helium in a neon tube is a warm peach color similar to the shine of most stars.  From Helium, a long list of elements are created by the same process, eventually producing heavier elements that we are very familiar with such as iron, carbon, oxygen.  In my works, I am using iron in steel frames for panels, carbon in deer hide and wood frames and oxygen with a panel of live plants (specifically cactus for conceptual reasons).  I will also be creating three more Periodic Elements in neon: Gold (Au), Silver (Ag) and Copper (Cu).  These three precious metals are elements that are ONLY created during supernovae explosions (when a star dies and explodes).  This is why we call them precious metals.  Some other things viewers can expect to see:

  • Three stretched deer hide works featuring Rorschachs (inkblots) and neon tubing
  • Two 3'x6' panels - one filled with pyrite (fools gold) and neon tubing, the other a live succulent panel combined with neon
  • A neon "bridge".  30 straight tubes of neon in a color progression that represents the sunset.  The tubes will span overhead, horizontally, across the width of the hallway and run the entire length leading into the exhibition room.

WHY I'M HERE: As you probably suspect, creating neon works can be very pricey. Everything is a specialty object from the glass and power sources to the equipment it takes to bend the tubes and process them.  I work on commissions here and there throughout the year that help supplement my income and fund my materials.  Ultimately, my exhibitions are what get the exposure and press that bring me the commissions.  When I'm not making my artwork, I am educating and caring for children in schools by substitute teaching and nanny-ing.  This allows me time in my studio to create the stuff!  

I'm here because my full time nanny-ing job and subbing isn't enough to fund my materials.  I live in San Francisco and the price of living is high!  It is becoming increasingly hard for an artist to continue to create quality work that adds value to the community with alternative materials.  By donating to this project, you are allowing a favored artist in the community to continue to live and work here (at least for this year).  You would contribute to one in a vast pool of artists that work to enrich the culture and aesthetic of our beloved city.  We're hanging on for dear life but till the very end!  I am here because I believe in a community of creators, innovators and enthusiasts alike. 

What I Need & What You Get

My funding is strictly going towards my materials:

  • Glass & Electrodes 
  • Steel
  • Wood
  • My live plants for panel 
  • Power sources 
  • Hardware
  • Gas for filling neon tubes
  • Transportation of materials and work for installation

My perks include handmade items from yours truly:

  • Handwritten thank you notes including one of my Rorschach inkblots
  • Hand-made jewelry works
  • Prints of neon works
  • Neon signs!


OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

If you can't help financially but love my project, please feel free to share with friends and your community!  Keep up with my process in the studio and the project status here: http://www.merylpataky.com/the-golden-hour-solo-exhibition-white-walls-gallery-san-francisco.html
story_txt:
My upcoming solo exhibition is scheduled for July 2014 at White Walls and Shooting Gallery in San Francisco.  This will be my second solo exhibition with White Walls.  Last year's show entitled, "Cellar Door" received warm reviews and recognition from press outlets such as Free People online, Refinery29, Live Fast Magazine and 7x7 Magazine to name a handful.  As I finalize my ideas for this upcoming exhibition, I work with a strong desire to progress forward and upward with my art and concepts.  Overall, my goal for the upcoming exhibition is to deliver to my audience (and hopefully new fans!) the same caliber of work and concept as they are used to seeing from me.  ABOUT MY WORK: I am a multi-disciplined artist working in a variety of materials.  I enjoy combining materials in unexpected ways - various metals, paper, neon, wood and organic mediums come together to form a story. story:
In the summer of 1987, I was obsessed with the mysteries of alchemy.  One afternoon, I was reading Grillot de Givry’s Picture Museum when I became fascinated by an illustration representing the Philosopher's Stone, the magical substance whose creation is the goal of the alchemical Great Work.  The illustration depicted the Stone as a type of mandala with a heart in the center, surrounded by a thorny wreath, and placed on a cross that divided the background into four sections.  Each quarter contained an image representing one of the four ancient elements: Earth, Water, Air, and Fire. In a flash of insight, I realized that the symbolism of the design was entirely interchangeable with that of the Tarot's World card. The dancing nude on the World, like this heart, is centered in a wreath and can be interpreted as a symbol for the soul. The creatures representing the four evangelists, standing in the corners of the World card, are also symbolically connected to the four elements through their correlation to the fixed signs of the zodiac. The thought came to me that if the final Tarot trump and the goal of the alchemical Great Work are related, all of the trumps may also relate to the Great Work. This realization was like a key that opened a lock to a forgotten door. I was mesmerized as images poured out of this new portal in my mind. They formed a parade of alchemical illustrations that were spontaneously paired with Tarot trumps and it became clear that the series of trumps does describe the alchemical Great Work. This insight led to years of research, and to the creation to one of the most beautiful and meaningful modern Tarot decks, The Alchemical Tarot.



The first edition of The Alchemical Tarot was published by Harper Collins, in London in 1995.  By 2003, it was out of print, but its reputation continued to grow. First editions of the deck and book set have sold on eBay for up to $2,075.00.  Although I have created eleven Tarot decks and authored several books on the Tarot and mysticism, including The Tarot: history, Symbolism, and Divination, which Booklist said may be the best book ever written on the subject, The Alchemical Tarot is what I am best known for.  In 2007,  I regained the rights to my work and published an updated version with improvements to the drawings and composition.  This was The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed. That edition and the next, The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 3rd Edition, are now out of print and I am ready to print The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Edition.  For each edition I have made improvements to the drawings and coloring, I have added alchemical symbolism, and designed a new card back. I have continued this process for the Fourth, and I feel that this is the best edition of The Alchemical Tarot.


   

The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed is a full 79 card Tarot deck (with two versions of the Lovers) that demonstrates the close link between alchemical symbolism and traditional Tarot imagery, and illustrates that the Tarot, like the alchemical quest, is designed to lead one to the gold of inner wisdom. 


The fourth edition of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed is a digitally redesigned version of the original with improvements. As with the other renewed versions, the art has been reproportioned so that the images are more prominent on the cards.  I have made further improvements in the drawings and colored them with transparent colors on a rich antique paper background, like an antique alchemical illustration. The cards will be 4.75 x 2.75 and come in a tuck box. They will be printed on the same heavy card stock as my Tarot of the Sevenfold Mystery and have the same durable finish and die-cut edges.  The deck includes the original Lovers card that was censored in the first publication and, as in the original, the Pages have been replaced with female figures, called Lades, to maintain the sexual balance. 



The deck has additional alchemical symbols added, such as the symbols for the alchemical operations that appear on each trump, and a new card back that may be the best one that I have designed. 



Each card in the fourth edition of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed is beautifully drawn and captures the enigmatic symbols of alchemy that are natural vehicles for communication with the unconscious mind and it can be used by Tarot readers at any level.


As an added perk I am also offering the updated companion book. This book is not just a guide for each of the illustrations and all of the symbolism in The Alchemical Tarot. This book includes a history of alchemy, a history of the Tarot’s major and minor suits with an exploration of the Tarot's symbolism and alchemical connections, and the most up-to-date  discussion in print of my divinatory techniques. This book is a necessary companion for anyone owning any edition of The Alchemical Tarot and an essential text for anyone who desires a deeper understanding of the Tarot in general.




THESE ARE THE TRUMPS


HERE ARE THE FOUR ACES

You can see all of the cards and find out more about the deck on my website:

The Alchemical Tarot Renewed


HERE IS A TAROT VIGNETTE, WITH ALL OF THE TRUMPS, BY LUIS AGUILAR


WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The deck is finished, ready for the printer. And I need your help, to raise the $6000 to cover the printing and shipping costs.  Of course, I am not just asking you to contribute.  Every level of participation brings its own reward. 

All perks will be delivered even if I do not reach the goal. They will be mailed starting in May. There are separate listing for perks to be mailed in the USA and for those mailed internationally.  You can order more than one perk.


HERE IS A LIST OF AMOUNTS AND PERKS 

 For $30

An archival 8.5” by 11” print  of any illustration from The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed, mailed in the US

For $50

An archival 8.5” by 11” print  of any illustration from The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed, mailed internationally

For $37

A copy of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed, mailed in the US

For $55

A copy of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed, mailed internationally

For $67

2 Copies of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed mailed in the US

For $85

2 Copies of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed mailed internationally

For $65

A copy of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed and my Book, Alchemy and the Tarot, mailed in the US

For $80

A copy of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed and my Book, Alchemy and the Tarot, mailed internationally

For $95

2 Copies of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed and my Book, Alchemy and the Tarot, mailed in the US

For $120

2 Copies of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed and my Book, Alchemy and the Tarot, mailed internationally

For $200

Two copies of The Alchemical Tarot: Renewed 4th Ed, my Book, Alchemy and the Tarot mailed in the US or internationally, and a one-hour Tarot reading with me over the phone or in person with the Alchemical Tarot


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Finally, help to spread the word. If you have enjoyed reading this, if the project excites you, then please help spread the word.  Even if you do not decide to pre-order the deck at this time, please pass on this announcement any way you can—Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, simple one-on-one communications…


 If you like this campaign you may also like my campaign for: 

The New York Lenormand

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!
