story:
Hello! My name is James Helenski and I am a trans artist working out of Boston. In May I will be graduating from The New England School of Art & Design with a degree in Fine Arts and Philosophy. My studio practice focuses mainly on printmaking, collage, sculpture, and performance art. For the past year, I have been interning with Liz Shepherd at her studio Shepherd Print Studio. Through my time in her studio I was able to connect with the Icelandic Printmakers Association. In the most incredible series of events I have been able to establish a residency program in their studio in Reykjavik this summer from June 10th - July 10th.

I am absolutely ecstatic over this wonderful opportunity and cannot wait to fly over. However, being a soon to be graduated art student my funds are not exactly in a place to support an extended stay in Iceland. With your help I hope to raise enough to cover the cost of air fair, living expenses, printing supplies, and shipping all of those supplies to Iceland.

I already have specific projects that I plan to carry out while in the Icelandic Printmakers' studio. Utilizing imagery from performances I have done in the past year which uses the body as its primary medium, I hope to further manipulate the body and translate the creation and destruction of the understood body into a print medium. I have included some of these videos in the gallery tab so you can take a look! I have many years of experience in screen printing, woodblock and linoleum cuts, and etching, but my hope is to explore this through cyanotypes, a process I have not yet had much experience with.

Reaching my goal ensures that I will not only be able to create a significant body of work, but also have the opportunity to connect with a trans community on the international stage. 


What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise at least $5,000 to mitigate the costs of flying to and from Reykjavik, travel within Iceland, buying supplies and shipping them over (I've been told it will be much cheaper to buy them here in America and ship them to the studio rather than buy them all there), living costs, and exchange rates.

If you check out the perks column you can see all the various goodies you can get for your contributions from a nice postcard, to zines, to prints. Any donations are greatly appreciated and I honestly cannot thank you enough but I hope I've figured out a few things that might begin to show you my appreciation. 


The Impact

I know this may seem like a project that will have very little impact beyond my own personal experience, but this has the opportunity to establish a new residency program and strong connection between Shepherd Print Studio and the Icelandic Printmakers Association. The success of this project can help future students, like myself, access an amazing experience and take the first steps in their professional artistic careers. It also allows for the opportunity of building a friendship with the trans community of Iceland of which I hope to connect with during my stay.


Risks & Challenges

There are very few risks and challenges that could present themselves. The residency is already in place, so I will not have to wait to hear back from a review board to see if I am granted a stay with the Icelandic Printmakers. All it comes down to is actually creating the work while I'm there. I could run into complications or technical issues with equipment in the studio which may impact my ability to print. However, the length of my stay should offer plenty of time to solve these issues should they appear and with the technique I am planning on exploring the most, cyanotypes, I can use the good old sun instead of fancy light exposure boxes. As I mentioned earlier I have not had much experience with the cyanotype process, but before I leave I will be working with my professors to get the basics down as well as creating a few test prints which will then allow me to experiment and try new approaches to the process while in Iceland.

My time in school has helped me develop a drive to be in the studio regularly and even though I will also be exploring Iceland since I have never been, I assure you that a good majority of my time will be spent working in the studio! You can keep tabs on my progress by checking out my process blog here: http://twoheadedblackcat.tumblr.com/


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everyone can contribute financially. But you can still help out! You can send this to your friends or share it on whatever social media sites you fancy. Spreading the word is just as helpful as any amount of money and I would greatly appreciate anything that you can do!

All it comes down to is actually creating the work while I'm there. I could run into complications or technical issues with equipment in the studio which may impact my ability to print. However, the length of my stay should offer plenty of time to solve these issues should they appear and with the technique I am planning on exploring the most, cyanotypes, I can use the good old sun instead of fancy light exposure boxes. As I mentioned earlier I have not had much experience with the cyanotype process, but before I leave I will be working with my professors to get the basics down as well as creating a few test prints which will then allow me to experiment and try new approaches to the process while in Iceland. 
My time in school has helped me develop a drive to be in the studio regularly and even though I will also be exploring Iceland since I have never been, I assure you that a good majority of my time will be spent working in the studio! You can keep tabs on my progress by checking out my process blog here: http://twoheadedblackcat.tumblr.com/

  Other Ways You Can Help I realize not everyone can contribute financially. But you can still help out! You can send this to your friends or share it on whatever social media sites you fancy. Spreading the word is just as helpful as any amount of money and I would greatly appreciate anything that you can do!

story:
Hi there! My name is Nim, and I have been sculpting for several years for my jewelry line Rude & Reckless. You can see some of my work at http://www.etsy.com/shop/rudeandreckless
My objective for this project was to make a detailed design to cast molds for bars of
"Elder God Soaps"  I've already created the initial sculpt and now need the materials to bring the soaps to life!  Those of us who have the soaps will be protected and accepted as followers to the Great One once he awakens!

 I'll be doing several conventions this year and need to ensure that I have enough to invest in supplies. Your contributions will bring this project to fruition, by enabling me to purchase the proper mold making materials, essential oils, and enough soap making and packaging supplies to make this happen. YOU are the reason the finished product will not only turn out, but look and smell amazing!

I  already have experience in soap making! The soaps I have made in the past are all hypoallergenic, and vegan friendly (containing no animal byproducts) and I'm in the midst of getting certified cruelty free by Peta. That is something I care quite a bit about. I use only essential oils as well, yes they are a bit more expensive in most cases, but they are so amazing, and using real ingredients instead of synthetics is what I prefer.
I need to repurchase all of my supplies as have very little on hand to even start with. I'm basically starting from scratch. Each of the finished Elder God bars will weigh approximately 3 oz, will come in "Musk of the Elder God" scent and will be your choice of either gray or green.

In order to make this magic happen, I will be making several molds from the original sculpture. These molds will enable me to pour and shape the soaps. I will be using silicone rubber for mold making as it is highly heat resistant, and will work wonderfully for this project.  I am aiming at getting enough supplies to not only begin this project, but to help as a start up for creating something more out of this endeavor. With enough funds I will readily be able to cast some of the other sculpts I have made into beautiful soap bars.

Cost for supplies breakdown:
Silicone rubber and additional mold making supplies/brushes/pouring and mixing containers: $180
Bulk soap making supplies/Shae butter/Mango Butter, Glycerin, Carrier oils
(Sweet almond, avocado, coconut, jojoba, castor oil, vitamin E etc) /mica pigments in several colors/essential oils: $350 (The ingredients I buy are only top notch, making them a bit more pricey, but so well worth the end result)
Epsom salts and lip balm ingredients/carnauba wax, candelilla wax, olive oil, flavoring etc. $60
Heat sealer/shrink wrap and label making supplies for soaps, lip balms, bath salts and sanity serum: $150
I also have to take into account shipping boxes/tape/bubble wrap and other packaging, I'm estimating this at around $75.
The remaining amount is for the additional percentage that Indigogo will take after
the finding goes through.
All of this money will be taken out of the funds, and it all adds up quickly!


This is an all or nothing campaign, so If I do not reach the desired amount you will get your donation back. If this project is fully funded, not only will Cthulu be very pleased, but you will receive your bar(s) of soap in relative quickness. I should be able to get the perks out within  3-4 months tops.

    If you cannot donate, don't fret, you can share to get the word out!
    If not for me, then for the Dark Lord, as if we do his bidding it will ensure all of our happiness and well being on this planet.

story:
Who I am

My name is Tomasz Cichowski and I am a contemporary visual artist from Poland. I have been practising painting, drawing, photography and video art for more than 20 years, and exhibited off and on in various galleries in Poland. Participating in The Other Art Fair would be a perfect opportunity for me to showcase my works to an international audience of art enthusiasts. I hope that my attendance, thanks to your generous donations, will push my artistic career to the next level!

What I need

The expenses which I need to cover include:

  • Booth fee - $1350
  • Shipping of artworks - $400
  • Accommodation for 6 nights -  $1200
  • Transportation - $600

All of the above amount to the $3550 goal. Other costs, such as insurance, artwork framing, perks and promotional materials, will not be covered using the funds raised in this campaign.

What you get

All perks are listed on the right-hand side. The $15 package includes a signed thank you card featuring one of my artworks - effectively a small art print. For just $35 you can become the owner of a unique artwork - I will send you a small abstract doodle drawing on paper. I've divided the more expensive perks ($50 and more) into two groups: prints and original artworks. 

All available artworks/prints are shown below. After you choose a perk, please send me a direct message with the number of your chosen artwork. The originals are obviously one-of-a-kind and prints have a limited number of copies. Once they're gone, they're gone - so the earlier you buy, the more selection you have!

Unavailable works will be marked as 'sold' in the description.  

_____________________________________________________

LIMITED EDITION PRINTS 

These five artworks were created earlier this year. They are only available as prints in this campaign. You can choose between small (approx. 20x30cm), medium (approx. 30x40cm) and large (approx. 40x60cm) format. They are limited to five copies per artwork in each size.


Artwork No. 1

 

 


Artwork No. 2

 

 


Artwork No. 3

 

 


Artwork No. 4

 

 


Artwork No. 5

 

ORIGINAL DRAWINGS

These three ink drawings come from the 'Downward' Series. They are signed on the reverse and come with a Certificate of Authenticity.


Artwork No. 1 
19x21cm | Ink on paper | 2013

 

Artwork No. 2 
19x21cm | Ink on paper | 2013

 

 

Artwork No. 3 
19x21cm | Ink on paper | 2013

 

 

ORIGINAL WATERCOLOURS

These three watercolours come from the 'Beyond the Horizon' Series. They are signed on the reverse and come with a Certificate of Authenticity. Please note: due to shipping costs, passe-partout is not included.

Artwork No. 1 
23x25cm | Watercolour on paper | 2012

 

 

Artwork No. 2 
25x24cm | Watercolour on paper | 2012

 

 

Artwork No. 3 
24x25cm | Watercolour on paper | 2012

 

 

LARGE WORKS ON PAPER

These large works on paper are signed on the reverse and come with a Certificate of Authenticity. More works from this series: click here

Artwork No. 1 
61x86cm | Gouache on paper | 2012

 

 


Artwork No. 2 
100x70cm | Gouache on paper | 2012

 

Artwork No. 3
40x70cm | Gouache on paper | 2012

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, and are unable to donate, please share this campaign on social media and spread the word!

story:
My name is Jonny and I am a 28 year old web entrepreneur from Colorado and I'm on a mission to accelerate the mainstream adoption of Bitcoin in every country in the world with help from stickers and YOU. 

Yup, stickers. It is my goal to produce and distribute at least 1,000,000 stickers around the world with 1 question and 1 call to action.

"What is Bitcoin?" and "#TryBitcoin"

This simple question will get people to wonder what Bitcoin is in hopes that they will search for an answer.

I am using a hashtag because I want people to be able to unite online around a common goal surrounding this project and get more people to #TryBitcoin! 

I feel that these 2 phrases are enough to get people to look into Bitcoin further and help it into mainstream acceptance.

Here is what I would like to achieve with this project:

- Produce and Distribute at least 1,000,000 stickers or more with the help of the Bitcoin community around the world and people just like you.

- Accelerate the widespread awareness, knowledge and adoption of Bitcoin all around the world.

- Get people to actually try Bitcoin.

Pledge packages are really simple. $5 gets you 5 stickers shipped to your door. $10 get you 10, $20 gets you 20, $50 $100 etc. All sticker packages are mix and match so you can pick from all of the designs available at the end of the campaign. 

Here are the first 4 designs for the project so far. I will br producing 3 more designs for every $1000 that gets pledged to the project. I have about 20 other designs ready to go into production and I want to have more than 100 designs in circulation by the end of Spring of 2014. I need to create a massive minimum order to get the best deal with the first production run. I might even open up some contests to have people submit their own designs and let people vote on which one gets put into production. 

Put them on any/all of the following...

car

cubicle at work 

toolbox

laptop

your iPad or computer tower

speaker cabinets

file cabinets

dog (actually not on your dog)

skateboard, snowboard, wakeboard, surfboard,

storefront window, 

locker at school, 

school books, 

guitar or drums set, 

tour van, guitar case, 

your mancave fridge

give them as gifts to your friends and family. 

Facebook

Twitter, 

Instagram

YouTube

Vine

Google+

Flickr

or anywhere else you think they will get lots of exposure.

If you would like to know more about Bitcoin and how it works, then make sure to watch these 2 videos on the basic idea behind Bitcoin with some great visual aid. 

Bitcoin Mining is the process by which bitcoins are made through the verification of complex mathmatical algorithms. Part of this verification process is that people verify your banking transactions as their computers mine bitcoin. Watch this video to learn more about Bitcoin Mining and how it might add value to your life.

story:
.........................An 8x10 of a drawing like this from the project (delivery by 04/2014) >>>>>


DELIBERATE CONNECTIONS

My Passion:

My drawings are about people connecting.

The act of drawing can connect people.

When I take to the streets with drawing paper and pencil, and the intent of creating a narrative with the moment, the narrative creates itself. People use the drawing as a springboard for conversation. I see them sometimes circling, craning their necks to see the picture. I look up, I smile, and they approach.

When I take to the streets with drawing paper and pencil, and the intent of creating a narrative with the moment, profound things always happen. People reach out to me because I listen. I experience their conversation with honest mature wonder and reflect back to them their own beauty.

When I take to the streets with drawing paper and pencil, and the intent of creating a narrative with the moment, the drawing that results captures not only the physical space, but also the energy of every person that talks to me, every person that passes close by to look, if only for a moment long enough for me to record them with my pencil.

 



My History:

As artist:

I have been making and exhibiting art for over twenty years. In all that time I have experimented with almost every material. I always come back to drawing.

Right now, I draw exclusively with graphite and paint on paper or canvas. My drawings are primarily figurative and I have honed my mark making to an autobiographical style that is gestural to the point of almost being physical, yet the marks maintain a delicateness of application and intent hoping that the drawings are experienced as a feeling as well as a visual.

My struggle, as usual, is to communicate in my compositions a sense of “present”. I want to transfer to the viewer of my drawings the moment as I actually experience it. This means more than simply reproducing objects, it means, “capturing time”. This struggle continues.

I have had notable exhibitions across the United States and Europe, most notably Chicago, Boston, Nashville, St. Louis, Paducah Kentucky and Innsbruck Austria. My exhibition history can be found at www.tmoore2.com (resume).

Six people sat on this bench during the four hours I sat drawing at the Government Center Line. I talked to them all. Some were nervous, some excited; all were curious.

As cyclist:

My drawings are physical partly because I am physical. Running turned to cycling in the mid nineties, and cycling has become a lifetime obsession.

When I am riding, my bike becomes an extension of my body.

Some years ago a friend convinced me I was capable of riding multi state cycle tours by myself. I did it, several times. I carry my gear, food, water, camping where I can and staying in hotels once and a while to clean up. The experience of travel on two wheels humbles me. It allows me to be stripped of pretense and the practice of calculating my moments. When I am on a tour, I am Teri, plain and simple, and it feels real.

When I meet people along the way, they are comfortably drawn to me with questions and comments. The bike seems like an equalizer of sorts. Everybody has experience riding bikes, and most everyone has a story about their experience riding that they want to share.  Just like when I am drawing, they talk, and I listen. The communication is real as we connect.

Surly Long Haul Trucker, my chariot. Bob, my trailer, and one person tent, my home (yellow bag under the table). Somewhere, Northern Illinois.

The parallel:

Drawing and cycling both create honest and real face-to-face connections.

 

The Project:

I will take an entire year to travel via bicycle to twenty towns with a population of under 10,000 people. I will choose towns within a 250-mile radius of a base location (as yet to be determined). In each small town, I will find a central square or some other heavily traveled area and I will draw. I will make three drawings of the area and the people passing, attempting to capture “a moment in time”. I will give one drawing to someone in the town. I will do this because the idea of someone who really loves a work owning it reminds me that “selling” isn’t a good reason to make the drawings. I will save one drawing to auction, with 100% of proceeds donated to United Way, a national system of volunteers, contributors, and local charities helping people in their own communities. The final drawing will become a part of a traveling exhibition to be shown in or near as many of the towns as possible.

In one year I will make sixty drawings, traveling to the city of the drawing via bicycle.  Twenty drawings will be given to someone in the town, twenty drawings will be auctioned with 100% of the proceeds going to United Way, and twenty drawings will be included in a traveling exhibition.

 

Why should you care?

In a day of smart phones, text messaging, laptops, video gaming, tweeting, blogging and endless forms of electronic communication this project hails to a sense of oft ignored “humanness”. Traveling through towns on my bike and working on narrative drawings creates a set of circumstances perfect for face to face human communication, sometimes a few short words, but more often than not profound in its connection.

Thoreau spoke of a “wish to live deliberately”. Drawings produced in this way, through this project, will give voice to the desire in all of us to “communicate deliberately”. And you can help me do it by being a contributor to my indigogo campaign.

It is my dream to create a larger “humanness”, and to share the result of this project with as many people in as many ways as possible.

“The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams” Eleanor Roosevelt

 

The children were drawn to me because I arrived on bike. I gave them paper and we all sat together to draw....until dad came to find them. I had dinner with them. Nice connection.

What I need: bike/draw connecting for one year

§  HomeBase; in the form of renting a studio (PROVIDED, IN KIND!)

§  Living stuff (food, insurance, cell phone, clothes, incidentals)

§  On the road housing in the form of camp fees and an occasional hotel to clean up in

§  Specialized bike gear/equipment (I already have the bike and the trailer, will need tires, tubes, pre trip bike overhaul)

§  Waterproof carrier for drawings/drawing supplies (like bike messengers carry)

§  Final Presentation materials (framing, hooks etc. for forty drawings)

)  Exhibition/Auction space rentals, and refreshments (up to ten spaces throughout the scope of the travel radius of the project)

§  Exhibition/Auction marketing (radio/newspaper/flyers)

§  Incentive books, art prints and postage to mail them to you!


Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution isn’t possible for you, you can spread the word, spread the word, spread the word! If you know folks who can and would contribute to the beauty of this project, please pass this on so it can happen.

And….smile today at someone you might not notice on an average day; give someone an honest compliment; look a person in the eye and take time to listen after you ask how they are.

We are all in this together.

I am not sure what Kay was saying, but she was so pleased to connect with me, that she came to get me later to try to get me to talk to a group of "regulars" at the Duncan Donuts next door. It made us both SMILE.


  

What will happen to your donation if this campaign does not reach its funding goal?

The Project will be completed, and all of the perks will be given. I will just scale down the time and distance to match what the total of the donations allow. (But lets not allow that to happen….a year of concentrated connections will produce profound drawings and experiences we will all share and benefit from.

travel via bicycle to twenty towns with a population of under 10,000 people. I
will choose towns within a 250-mile radius of a base location (as yet to be
determined). In each small town, I will find a central square or some other
heavily traveled area and I will draw. I will make three drawings of the area
and the people passing, attempting to capture “a moment in time”. I will give
one drawing to someone in the town. I will do this because the idea of someone
who really loves a work owning it reminds me that “selling” isn’t a good reason
to make the drawings. I will save one drawing to auction, with 100% of proceeds
donated to United Way, a national system of volunteers, contributors, and local
charities helping people in their own communities. The final drawing will
become a part of a traveling exhibition to be shown in or near as many of the
towns as possible. 
In one year I will make sixty
drawings, traveling to the city of the drawing via bicycle.  Twenty drawings will be given to
someone in the town, twenty drawings will be auctioned with 100% of the
proceeds going to United Way, and twenty drawings will be included in a
traveling exhibition.
 
Why should you care?
In a day
of smart phones, text messaging, laptops, video gaming, tweeting, blogging and
endless forms of electronic communication this project hails to a sense of oft
ignored “humanness”. Traveling through towns on my bike and working on
narrative drawings creates a set of circumstances perfect for face to face
human communication, sometimes a few short words, but more often than not
profound in its connection.
Thoreau spoke of a “wish to live
deliberately”. Drawings produced in this way, through this project, will give
voice to the desire in all of us to “communicate deliberately”. And you can
help me do it by being a contributor to my indigogo campaign. 
It is my dream to create a larger
“humanness”, and to share the result of this project with as many people in as
many ways as possible.
“The future belongs to those who
believe in the beauty of their dreams” Eleanor Roosevelt
 


The children were drawn to me because I arrived on bike. I gave them paper and we all sat together to draw....until dad came to find them. I had dinner with them. Nice connection.
What I need: bike/draw connecting for
one year
§  HomeBase; in the form of renting a studio (PROVIDED, IN KIND!)
§ 
Living stuff (food, insurance, cell phone, clothes, incidentals)
§ 
On the road housing in the form of camp fees and an occasional hotel to
clean up in 
§ 
Specialized bike gear/equipment (I already have the bike and the
trailer, will need tires, tubes, pre trip bike overhaul)
§ 
Waterproof carrier for drawings/drawing supplies (like bike messengers carry)
§ 
Final Presentation materials (framing, hooks etc. for forty drawings)
)  Exhibition/Auction space rentals, and refreshments (up to ten spaces
throughout the scope of the travel radius of the project)
§ 
Exhibition/Auction marketing (radio/newspaper/flyers)
§ 
Incentive books, art prints and
postage to mail them to you!



Other Ways You Can Help 
If a financial contribution isn’t possible for you,
you can spread the word, spread the word, spread the word! If you know folks
who can and would contribute to the beauty of this project, please pass this on
so it can happen.
And….smile today at someone you might not notice on
an average day; give someone an honest compliment; look a person in the eye and
take time to listen after you ask how they are.
We are all in this together.

I am not sure what Kay was saying, but she was so pleased to connect with me, that she came to get me later to try to get me to talk to a group of "regulars" at the Duncan Donuts next door. It made us both SMILE.
  
What will happen to your donation
if this campaign does not reach its funding goal?
The Project will be completed, and all of the perks
will be given. I will just scale down the time and distance to match what the
total of the donations allow. (But lets not allow that to happen….a year of concentrated
connections will produce profound drawings
and experiences we will all share and benefit from.

story:
My name is T Love.  I am in love with poetry and through it, I've completely turned my life around.  You can learn more about how through my poetry.  I have been performing and competing in slams since 2008.  I have competed in the National Poetry Slam twice and attended the Women of the World Poetry Slam for the past two years as a coach.  

You can download my poetry for free or by donation at T LOVE'S POETRY

The Women of the World Poetry Slam (WOWPS) is an event where I feel the most empowered and supported as a female-bodied queer-identified poet.  Having the experience of attending both competitions, what I love most about WOWPS is that it pushes the powerful female voice out to the forefront and empowers and celebrates the lives and experiences of women.  As far as I have experienced, it is the only thing like this in the world.  

The challenge of expressing myself at this level of competition is really important to me because there will be several women there who I look up to and respect greatly.  I feel it will be an important learning experience for me and provide me with opportunities to meet and compete with women from all over the world.  This is an experience of a lifetime and I am full of hope that you will help me succeed at this dream.

Currently I am a volunteer mentor and teaching artist for the Multilingual Leadership Corps as an Americorps where I work with at-risk youth at the 21st Century After School Program at Lewiston Middle School.  Your contributions are deeply appreciated as they will provide me the opportunity to work with my role models.  This will enable me to continue the work that I do and grow as a poet so that I can give back more to the young folks I work with.

My hope is to raise my monetary goal so that I can leave a week in advance and to take a mini-tour to share my poetry with audiences in the southern states of Virginia, Tennessee, Arkansas and Texas.  A friend is loaning me his car which is very good on gas but Austin is over 2,000 miles away.  This is why I need your help.  

I will need approximately $2000+ which includes the registration fees, gas, food and lodging to drive from Portland, Maine to stay in Austin, TX for 3 nights.  I have set my online goal at $1500 because I believe I can save up the rest on my own, however every little bit helps.

By donating to this campaign, you will be showing your support for me and in return you will receive the benefit of some really cool perks of T Love merchandise like your own custom-made poems or some of my collections of poems both in print and audio form or you can have one-on-one performance coaching or a performance and workshop combo.  These are some really unique and priceless perks as a thank you for contributing what you can to send me to the Women of the World Poetry Slam.

If you can't make a financial contribution yourself, you can still help show your support by asking your friends and family to contribute or help spread the word by sharing our link on Facebook and other social media. 

Thank you so much for helping out in whatever way you can.  It means so much to me to be part of such an inspiring and supportive community.  

Thank you!!!

Love and light, 

T Love

story:
Cultural & Educational Programming

Dia De Los Muertos Festival

The sixth annual Dia de los Muertos Street Festival is hosted by K Space Contemporary (a 501(c)3, non-profit organization) and neighboring Axis Tattoo. The event will be held on Saturday, November 2, 3pm to midnight in downtown Corpus Christi, Texas on Starr and Mesquite streets. 

The event has gained national attention in recent years and was included in MSN's Top 10 Dia de los Muertos Celebrations in the US in 2012.  We hope to raise $7500 through this campaign, so that the event may remain FREE to the public. 

The festival includes three stages: 1) Andrews MainStage presents live Latin-influenced rock music - including headliner, Pinata Protest; 2) Cultural Performance Stage presents traditional dance and music of Mexico and Latin America;  3) MusicWalk's Funky Rockin' Soul Stage presents a variety of upcoming musicians.  

Dia de los Muertos Street Festival includes a Made-by-Hand Art Expo of over 75 vendors selling art, craft items, jewelry, hats, purses and painting faces; Community Altar; Kids' Corner with craft activities, games, and rock-climbing wall; Loteria! Fine Art Exhibition and Extravagancia de Pinatas youth art contest, art demonstrations, and family-friendly fun.  

See how your contribution will help below:

CULTURAL PERFORMANCE STAGE 

Remaining Amount Needed $2500:

This year, we will present a variety of entertainment reflecting the history and artistry of Mexico.  In addition to local Ballet Folklorico dance companies, we are seeking funds to bring other performers: a traditional Axtec dance group, Xavier Garza-storyteller and writer of bilingual children's books, Mariachi Bandolero, La Comparza Xantolo (dance company from Vera Cruz), Flamenco, Tejano and Salsa groups.  The majority of our performers are from South Texas.  Texas Commission on the Arts has contributed funding towards this stage, however, more is still needed.  Funding will cover rental costs for the stage, sound and lighting equipment and seating for the audience, DJ and performance fees. 


STREET SET-UP: Need $3500

Funding is needed for Security (8-10 Off-Duty Policemen), Medics, Skid-O-Kans, hand-washing stations, Tower Lights, additional dumpsters for trash, Street Closure Permit, Event Permit.  The total cost is $7000.  Corpus Christi Downtown Management District is contributing $3000 towards these costs, and we expect to raise more through sponsorships.

LOTERIA! THE EXHIBITION

Need $1000

LOTERIA! the Exhibition will be displayed November 1 - 21 in the main gallery of K Space Contemporary, along with the Extravagancia de Piñatas, a contest and exhibition of piñatas constructed by area K-12 school groups/art classes/art clubs.   Over 75 artists are partcipating in Loteria! the Exhibition - including many top artists in our region.  Each artist is creating an original version of a Loteria card which will be displayed in grids, like "tablas" or Bingo cards.   The show will consist of 10-12 giant tablas of 9 cards each. In addition, a community altar will provide an opportunity for our visitors to pay tribute to decease loved ones by adding written remembrances to the structure.  Funding will assist with coordination, photography, advertising, installation and facility costs.

 

CULTURAL EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS - Need $500

Funding will cover art supplies, instructors' fees and facility costs. One class will be offered free of charge.  Classes will include: Loteria Paint-Along, Paper Mache masks & pinatas, Wire Skeleton figures, Papel Picado (cut paper) & tissue paper flowers.  

 

The Impact 

Dia de los Muertos Street Festival has grown to almost 20,000 in attendance attracting tourists to Corpus Christi and Coastal Bend residents to downtown.  It draws around 300 festival participants - artists, art and food vendors, performers and musicians.  The funds gathered here will help the event remain FREE to the public.

Any funding over and above our goal will be used towards the creation of a "Loteria" mural to be developed from works exhibited in the "Loteria" exhibition mentioned above.  The mural is scheduled to be completed in 2014.

Dia de los Muertos Street Festival is coordinated by K Space Contemporary and Electra Art*Axis Tattoo in partnership with Andrews Distributing Company, Corpus Christi Downtown Management District, Grande Communications and House of Rock. Proceeds benefit K Space Contemporary, a 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to presenting and promoting contemporary art.  More information is available at http://www.diadelosmuertoscc.com/.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donations also accepted at

K Space Contemporary, P.O. Box 545, Corpus Christi, TX 78403.  

Can’t contribute? You can still help!

Help us get the word out about the festival by going to https://www.facebook.com/dayofthedeadcc and sharing the site with your friends, by using the Indiegogo share tools, or by simply coming to the festival and having a blast!

Other Ways You Can Help
Donations also accepted at
K Space Contemporary, P.O. Box 545, Corpus Christi, TX 78403.  
Can’t contribute? You can still help!
Help us get the word out about the festival by going to https://www.facebook.com/dayofthedeadcc and sharing the site with your friends, by using the Indiegogo share tools, or by simply coming to the festival and having a blast!

story:
Startartist is a new project that wants to change the way in which art is discovered and sold all over the world.

What do we want Startartist to be:

We think there is a need for a place where good artists can start selling their art,  take the first steps into the market and get noticed all around the world.

We also think there is a need for a place where people can spot and buy original artworks at an affordable price, with or without having  trading skills.

We would like Startartist to be the answer to these needs. We want it to be global and we want it to be equal.

Why is Startartist different:

There are plenty of  sites out there where you can find artists and buy art, but  we’ve always hadthe impression that you have to pay a lot of money for something meaningful, or to be extremely gifted to select an artist  from the pile. Furthermore, it’s always seemed to us that, if something has a reasonable price, somehow there is a trick.

At Startartist, we’ve got a set of rules in mind that must  be followed by the artists  who want to get on board: once you are in, you will have your display on our platform and you will be ready to sell. As a customer, you will be able to surf through the database by multiple criteria,  in line with what you are looking for. No surprises: simple and equal.

And  most importantly: you will buy  certified originals from a fresh talented artist.

Why are we planning a crowd funding campaign?

Crowd funding such a social idea is a way of testing it, and making people part of its development. We may sound crazy, but even  if we had the budget, we would be doing exactly what we are doing.

How do you expect people to fund your campaign?

We did our homework, and we  asked ourselves: would we give someone money just to develop  an idea  they had in mind?

Tricky question. Maybe.

Let's try again: would we give money to someone to develop an idea, to get a cup or a t-shirt with a drawing  by those new artists they are talking about?

If it is fair, why not? But we are still not hitting the spot.

Here's the best answer: regardless ofl the previous scenarios, we would give money  above all to someone who is showing that their idea is working. That's the point: it  will be more than just words!

To do so, we want to offer the chance to buy a copy of 10 artworks created for Startartist from 10 artists around the world. We will show that there is a world wide opening to our approach, and that it is possible to find new talents  at a reasonable price. Indeed copies will be sold during the crowd funding process, but it will be a limited series that will  forever be the inception of Startartist.

PERKS

We held a contest to select 10 artists in the entire world. We gave them a theme on which they produced works of art specifically for Startartist. The theme we gave them was

“All Art is contemporary, the entire world is contemporary”                                           Art is contemporary as the world that is creating it, Art is a reflection of our time. Art is a universal language that allows the understanding of different cultures, and nowadays there are no geographical limits when it is time to create, generating a unique connection between cultures.

All the works are in A4 format and in a limited number. 

Limited edition (100 for each).

The works will be printed on the highest quality paper and accompanied by authenticity certification.

1) Artist: Jit Chowdhury (India)


  


2) Artist: Angela Monteiro (Portugal)

 



3) Artist: Fanzilla Luo (China)

     

4) Artist: Inés Isaurralde (Argentina) 

    





5) Artist: Karla Sotres (Mexico)


  

6) Artist: Michael A. Morrison (Australia)




7) Artist: Ernesto Perez (USA)



8) Artist: Ikuko (Japan)




9) Artist: Zohair Salama (Egypt)



10) Artist: Karin and the camera (Italy)


For further information on the artists, go to www.startartist.com

Catalogue: The catalogue contains all the works of art for sale with information on the artists, their works and the startartist project.

SHIPPING

Remember to add shipping cost: 12$ Europe, 24$ rest of the world.

In case you forgot to include the shipping cost when selecting a product, you can use the perk to add it. 

SUPPORTERS

Supporters can send us their photographs to thanks@startartist.com.  They will be inserted in a “thank you” video.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you think the project is valid, it is very important that you help us share and publicise the campaign. Let your contacts and friends know about our project.

ARE YOU AN ARTIST ?

If you’re an artist and you’d like your work to be sold on Startartist, send us an e-mail at  artist@startartist.com

IN THE PRESS

www.bergamosera.com

www.ecodibergamo.it

www.fineartconnoisseur.com
BLOG
www.albertoapostoli.com
www.pugliastartup.it

PRESENTATION  

Imagine a place where you can browse through the works of artists from all over the world. A place that brings together photography, illustrations and paintings from all parts of the globe. You’ll think you’ve stumbled on to one of those charcoal sketches you find strolling at Montmartre or prints seen at Soho, or even those elegant and refined drawings discovered in a tiny town in Korea. Now, young artists finally have a large marketplace where they can show their work and where you can purchase it with a authenticity guarantee. 

WHAT A SURPRISE!

Startartist is the name of this marketplace which is as big as the world, a WEBSITE where emerging artists can find the walls of your home. Discover new artists every month that have passed our selection and have been admitted to the Startartist programme and buy the work that will make your house unique and original.


MISSION

To present the art of new talented artists to the world.

To nourish artistic culture, starting with the possibility of purchasing the works of emerging artists.

Today’s art trade is a pyramid: few people have the power in this closed market where a limited number of people have access.

Startartist makes its prime objective that of helping art emerge from the most remote corners of the earth and society. It leaves its users the liberty of judging if a work of art or an artist is noteworthy or not.

Startartist wants to create an alternative art market where the artists has the possibility of selling their works, and where every art lover can find authentic works from all over the world. Anyone who makes art must have the opportunity to present their works to be shown. Anyone who loves art must have the possibility of purchasing authentic works.

The goal is to economically nourish artistic culture, starting from the foundations.

For the customer, art can become a form of investment that may even become profitable with time. Buying an original work from an unknown artist could turn out to be a winning venture that is economically remunerative. Tomorrow’s leading artist is surely to be found amongst today’s unknown artists. You need only to find that artist.


PHILOSOPHY

We have a dream: getting rid of the distance between the public and emerging art. Talented artists scattered over the world are just waiting to be discovered and seen. Startartist is a showcase for works of art where an artist exhibits and promotes his or her work.

The art will be seen even before it has been understood.

HOW DOES STARTARTIST WORK?

Startartist is an online platform for selling works of art.

Startartist allows artists from all over the world to sell their work and at the same time, offers those who want to decorate their homes the possibility of finding unique works of art that are certified and signed, with the same price as those found in home furnishings department stores.

The website is the link between customer and artist.

The way it works is simple and clear. First the artists upload the credentials for their work of art on Startartist (photos, title, year, artist’s CV, size, technique used and the number of copies if it is a print) which, after being approved by Startartist art director, are published and made visible to everyone.

Art lovers or the simply inquisitive, anyone looking for something unique can consult the works published on the website and buy them instantly by online payment. Startartist charges a percentage for the transactions.

Shipping is done directly between the artist and the customer. The work is rolled up and sent without a frame in a tube. Each work sold on Startartist is signed and certified. For prints or photographs, the artist must declare the number of copies made in order to create limited editions.

Startartist is where you can take a chance on artists who might one day be successful and make a name for themselves in art.

WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO ?
With the Crowdfunding campaign we want to invite people to be part of our development. The  fundings will help us to develop our platform.



TIMELINE


NOT CONVINCED?

Tell us why info@startartist.com

FAQ

  • How can I buy a work in the Indiegogo campaign?

        You must select the perks and add the shipping price. For deliveries inside the           EU, the cost is 12 dollars and 24 dollars outside the EU.

  • What are the next steps in the project?

        At the end of the crowdfunding campaign, the platform project will be set up for         selling works of art online while at the same time recruiting will commence for             artists who intend on participating. Once the platform is launched, in                              September 2015, each month we will select new artists who can publish their              works on Startartist.

  • I’m an artist and I’d like to participate in the Startartist project. May I send my candidature even during the crowdfunding campaign?

        Of course, selections are open. Just write to artist@startartist.com

  • What is the added value when you buy through Startartist?

        The customer buys a work with artistic value; it is unique, original and certified.

       The work’s value will also appreciate in time becoming a possible source of                  investment.

  • What is the added value by selling works of art through Startartist?

        Artists can sell works of art all over the world obtaining greater visibility. Artists         not yet on the traditional art market will have the possibility of being discovered        by the public.

  • Are you an Art Gallery?

        Startartist will also become an instrument for galleries because they can use it          to develop their collections! They can discover emerging artists from all over the        world and launch a new artist before anyone else does.

TEAM

Nicola, Paola, Lucia, Stefano

Nicola (33) interior designer
Paola (33) semiologist 
Lucia (29) Art historian and Museologist
Stefano (33) Aerospace Engineer

PRESENTAZIONE

Immagina un luogo dove poter curiosare tra le opere di artisti provenienti da tutto il mondo, un luogo che raccoglie fotografie, illustrazioni e dipinti che arrivano da ogni parte del globo. Ti sembrerà di scorgere quei carboncini che si trovano passeggiando a Montmartre, o quelle stampe viste a Soho, oppure quei disegni eleganti e raffinati scovati in un paesino in Corea. I giovani artisti hanno finalmente trovato una grande piazza dove poter mostrare i propri lavori e dove tu puoi acquistarli in direttamente da casa e con la garanzia di autenticità e unicità dell’opera.

Startartist è il nome di questa piazza grande come il mondo, un portale online dove gli artisti emergenti incontrano le pareti di casa tua. Scopri ogni mese i nuovi artisti, che hanno superato la selezione e sono stati ammessi al programma Startartist, e acquista l’opera che renderà la tua casa unica e originale.

Startartist è un nuovo progetto che vuole cambiare il modo in cui l'arte viene scoperta e scambiata, in tutto il mondo.

MISSION

Divulgare l’arte degli artisti sconosciuti al mercato tradizionale dell’arte.

Alimentare la cultura artistica, partendo dalla possibilità di acquistare opere di artisti emergenti.

Il mercato dell’arte oggi è organizzato in modo piramidale: poche persone hanno il potere di stabilire se un artista può e deve vendere. E’ un mercato chiuso, dove un numero limitato di persone hanno accesso.

Il mondo è pieno di Arte. Startartist si pone come obbiettivo quello di fare emergere l’arte dagli angoli più remoti del pianeta e della società. Lasciando agli utenti la libertà di decretare se un opera o un artista è degno di nota o meno. Startartist vuole creare un mercato dell’arte alternativo dove ogni artista ha la possibilità di vendere le proprie opere, e dove ogni amante dell’arte può trovare opere autentiche da ogni parte del mondo. Chiunque fa arte deve poter essere visto. Chiunque ama l’arte deve poter comprare opere autentiche.

L’obbiettivo è quello di alimentare anche economicamente la cultura artistica, partendo dalla base.

L’arte può diventare per chi aquista una forma di investimento che col tempo può essere redditizio. Comprare oggi un’ opera originale di un artista sconosciuto potrebbe rivelarsi una scommessa vincente ed economicamente remunerativa. Tra gli artisti sconosciuti di oggi ci sarà l’artista famoso di domani. Basta trovarlo.


FILOSOFIA

Abbiamo un sogno: annullare la distanza che c’è tra il pubblico e l’arte emergente. Artisti talentuosi sparsi per il mondo aspettano solo di essere scovati e visti. Startartist è una vetrina di opere d’arte dove un artista espone e promuove il proprio lavoro.

L’arte sarà vista ancor prima di essere capita.

COME FUNZIONA STARTARTIST?

Startartist è una piattaforma on line di vendita di opere d’arte.

Startartist permette agli artisti di tutto il mondo di vendere le loro opere e, nel contempo, offre a chi vuole arredare casa di trovare opere uniche, certificate e firmate, a prezzi che si allineano con quelli di grandi magazzini d’arredamento.

Il sito è il collegamento tra cliente e artista.

Il funzionamento è semplice e chiaro: l’artista carica su Startartist le credenziali delle  proprie opere (foto, titolo, anno, curriculum dell’artista, dimensioni, tecnica usata e numero di copie se si tratta di stampe) che, dopo essere state approvate, vengono pubblicate e rese visibili a tutti.

L’ amante dell’arte, il curioso, chiunque sia alla ricerca di qualcosa di unico consulta le opere pubblicate nel sito e compra istantaneamente attraverso pagamento on line. Startartist trattiene una percentuale sulle transazioni.

La spedizione avviene direttamente tra l’artista e il cliente, l’opera viene spedita non intelaiata e arrotolata in un tubo da spedizioni.

Ogni opera venduta su Startartist è firmata e certificata. Nel caso di stampe o fotografie l’artista è tenuto a dichiarare il numero effettivo di copie.

Startartist è un luogo in cui scommettere su artisti che potrebbero un giorno avere successo ed affermarsi nel mercato dell’arte.

DONATORI

I donatori possono mandarci la propria foto a thanks@startartist.com . Saranno inseriti in un video di ringraziamento.

PERKS

Attraverso un contest abbiamo selezionato 10 artisti in tutto il mondo. Abbiamo dato loro un tema sul quale hanno prodotto delle opere specifiche per Startartist. Il tema dato è stato

“All Art is contemporary, the entire world is contemporary”

Art is contemporary as the world that is creating it, Art is a reflection of our time.

Art is an universal language that allows the understanding of different cultures, and nowadays there are no geographical limits when it is time to create, generating a unique connection between cultures.

Tutte le opere sono in formato A4 e riprodotte in numerazione limitata. 

Serie limitata (100 cad.)

Le opere saranno stampate su carta di altissima qualità accompagnate dalla certificazione di autenticità.

Per maggiorni informazioni riguardo agli artisti andate su www.startartist.com

Catalogo: Il catalogo contiene tutte le opere in vendita con le informazioni sugli artisti, sulle opere e sul progetto startartist.


ALTRI MODI PER ESSERE D'AIUTO

Se pensate che il progetto sia di valore è molto importante per noi che ci aiutate a condividere e diffondere la campagna. Informate i vostri contatti e i vostri amici del nostro progetto.

SEI UN ARTISTA ?

Se sei un’artista e ti piacerebbe che le tue opere siano vendute su Startartist inviaci una mail a artist@startartist.com

FAQ

Come posso comprare un’opera della campagna di Indiegogo ???

Devi selezionare il perks e aggiungere alla cifra totale l'importo per la spedizione. Per le spedizioni all’interno dell’UE il costo è di 12 dollari mentre fuori UE è di 24 dollari.


Quali saranno i prossimi step di progetto?

Al termine della campagna di crowdfounding verrà realizzato il progetto della piattaforma per la vendita online delle opere d’arte contestualmente verrà aperto il reclutamento degli artisti che vi intendono partecipare. Una volta lanciata la piattaforma, a Settembre 2015 ogni mese selezioneremo nuovi artisti che potranno pubblicare le loro opere su Startartist.


Sono un artista, vorrei partecipare al progetto Startartist, posso inviare la mia candidatura anche durante la campagna di crowdfounding?

Certo, la selezione è già aperta. Scrivi a artist@startartist.com


Che cosa guadagnerà chi compra attraverso Startartist????

Il cliente acquisterà un’opera che ha un valore artistico, è unica, originale e certificata.

Inoltre l’opera acquisterà valore nel tempo diventando una possibile fonte di investimento.

Che cosa guadagnerà l’artista che venderà la sua opera attraverso Startartist?

L’artista venderà le sue opere in tutto il mondo raggiungendo una grande visibilità. Artisti non ancora entrati nel mercato tradizionale dell’arte avranno la possibilità di essere scoperti dal pubblico.

E se sei una galleria d’arte?

Startartist diventerà uno strumento anche per le gallerie, perchè potranno arricchire le proprie collezioni! E’ possibile scoprire artisti emergenti provenienti da tutto il mondo per poter lanciare prima di altri un nuovo artista.
story_txt:
Startartist is a new project that wants to change the way in which art is discovered and sold all over the world.What do we want Startartist to be:
We
think there is a need for a place where good artists can start selling their
art,  take the first steps into the market
and get noticed all around the world.
We
also think there is a need for a place where people can spot and buy original
artworks at an affordable price, with or without having  trading skills.
We
would like Startartist to be the answer to these needs. We want it to be global
and we want it to be equal.
Why is Startartist different:
There
are plenty of  sites out there where you
can find artists and buy art, but  we’ve
always hadthe impression that you have to pay a lot of money for something
meaningful, or to be extremely gifted to select an artist  from the pile. Furthermore, it’s always seemed to us that, if something
has a reasonable price, somehow there is a trick.
At
Startartist, we’ve got a set of rules in
mind that must  be followed by the artists
 who want to get on board: once you are
in, you will have your display on our platform and you will be ready to sell.
As a customer, you will be able to surf through the database by multiple
criteria,  in line with what you are
looking for. No surprises: simple and equal.
And
 most importantly: you will buy  certified originals from a fresh talented
artist.
Why are we planning a crowd funding campaign?
Crowd
funding such a social idea is a way of testing it, and making people part of
its development. We may sound crazy, but even  if we had the budget, we would be doing exactly
what we are doing.
How do you expect people to fund your campaign?
We
did our homework, and we  asked ourselves:
would we give someone money just to develop  an idea  they had in mind?
Tricky
question. Maybe.
Let's
try again: would we give money to someone to develop an idea, to get a cup or a
t-shirt with a drawing  by those new
artists they are talking about?
If
it is fair, why not? But we are still not hitting the spot.
Here's
the best answer: regardless ofl the previous scenarios, we would give money  above all to someone who is showing that their
idea is working. That's the point: it  will be more than just words!

To do so, we want to offer the
chance to buy a copy of 10 artworks created for Startartist from 10 artists
around the world. We will show that there is a world wide opening to our
approach, and that it is possible to find new talents  at a reasonable price. Indeed copies will be sold during the crowd
funding process, but it will be a limited series that will  forever be the inception of Startartist.PERKSWe held a contest to select 10 artists in the entire world. We gave them a theme on which they produced works of art specifically for Startartist. The theme we gave them was“All Art is contemporary, the entire world is contemporary”                                           Art is contemporary as the world that is creating it, Art is a reflection of our time. Art is a universal language that allows the understanding of different cultures, and nowadays there are no geographical limits when it is time to create, generating a unique connection between cultures.All the works are in A4 format and in a limited number. Limited edition (100 for each).The works will be printed on the highest quality paper and accompanied by authenticity certification. 1) Artist: Jit Chowdhury (India)  
2) Artist: Angela Monteiro (Portugal)
 3) Artist: Fanzilla Luo (China)

     4) Artist: Inés Isaurralde (Argentina) 
    



5) Artist: Karla Sotres (Mexico)



  

6) Artist: Michael
A. Morrison (Australia)








7) Artist: Ernesto Perez (USA)






8) Artist: Ikuko (Japan)





9) Artist: Zohair Salama (Egypt)




10) Artist: Karin and the camera (Italy)


For further information on the artists, go to www.startartist.com
Catalogue: The catalogue contains all the works of art for sale with information on the artists, their works and the startartist project.
SHIPPING
Remember to add shipping cost: 12$ Europe, 24$ rest of the world.
In case you forgot to include the shipping cost when selecting a product, you can use the perk to add it. 

SUPPORTERS
Supporters can send us their photographs to thanks@startartist.com.  They will be inserted in a “thank you” video.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you think the project is valid, it is very important that you help us share and publicise the campaign. Let your contacts and friends know about our project.
ARE YOU AN ARTIST ?
If you’re an artist and you’d like your work to be sold on Startartist, send us an e-mail at  artist@startartist.com
IN THE PRESS


www.bergamosera.com


www.ecodibergamo.it




www.fineartconnoisseur.com

BLOG

www.albertoapostoli.com


www.pugliastartup.it


PRESENTATION  
Imagine a place where you can browse through the works of artists from all over the world. A place that brings together photography, illustrations and paintings from all parts of the globe. You’ll think you’ve stumbled on to one of those charcoal sketches you find strolling at Montmartre or prints seen at Soho, or even those elegant and refined drawings discovered in a tiny town in Korea. Now, young artists finally have a large marketplace where they can show their work and where you can purchase it with a authenticity guarantee. 
WHAT A SURPRISE!
Startartist is the name of this marketplace which is as big as the world, a WEBSITE where emerging artists can find the walls of your home. Discover new artists every month that have passed our selection and have been admitted to the Startartist programme and buy the work that will make your house unique and original.
MISSION
To present the art of new talented artists to the world.
To nourish artistic culture, starting with the possibility of purchasing the works of emerging artists.
Today’s art trade is a pyramid: few people have the power in this closed market where a limited number of people have access.
Startartist makes its prime objective that of helping art emerge from the most remote corners of the earth and society. It leaves its users the liberty of judging if a work of art or an artist is noteworthy or not.
Startartist wants to create an alternative art market where the artists has the possibility of selling their works, and where every art lover can find authentic works from all over the world. Anyone who makes art must have the opportunity to present their works to be shown. Anyone who loves art must have the possibility of purchasing authentic works.
The goal is to economically nourish artistic culture, starting from the foundations.
For the customer, art can become a form of investment that may even become profitable with time. Buying an original work from an unknown artist could turn out to be a winning venture that is economically remunerative. Tomorrow’s leading artist is surely to be found amongst today’s unknown artists. You need only to find that artist.
PHILOSOPHY
We have a dream: getting rid of the distance between the public and emerging art. Talented artists scattered over the world are just waiting to be discovered and seen. Startartist is a showcase for works of art where an artist exhibits and promotes his or her work.
The art will be seen even before it has been understood.
HOW DOES STARTARTIST WORK?
Startartist is an online platform for selling works of art.
Startartist allows artists from all over the world to sell their work and at the same time, offers those who want to decorate their homes the possibility of finding unique works of art that are certified and signed, with the same price as those found in home furnishings department stores.
The website is the link between customer and artist.
The way it works is simple and clear. First the artists upload the credentials for their work of art on Startartist (photos, title, year, artist’s CV, size, technique used and the number of copies if it is a print) which, after being approved by Startartist art director, are published and made visible to everyone.
Art lovers or the simply inquisitive, anyone looking for something unique can consult the works published on the website and buy them instantly by online payment. Startartist charges a percentage for the transactions.
Shipping is done directly between the artist and the customer. The work is rolled up and sent without a frame in a tube. Each work sold on Startartist is signed and certified. For prints or photographs, the artist must declare the number of copies made in order to create limited editions.
Startartist is where you can take a chance on artists who might one day be successful and make a name for themselves in art.
WHERE DO THE FUNDS GO ?

With the Crowdfunding campaign we want to invite people to be part of our development. The  fundings will help us to develop our platform.










TIMELINE








NOT CONVINCED?
Tell us why info@startartist.com
FAQ


How can I buy a work in the Indiegogo campaign?

        You must select the perks and add the shipping price. For deliveries inside the           EU, the cost is 12 dollars and 24 dollars outside the EU.


What are the next steps in the project?

        At the end of the crowdfunding campaign, the platform project will be set up for         selling works of art online while at the same time recruiting will commence for             artists who intend on participating. Once the platform is launched, in                              September 2015, each month we will select new artists who can publish their              works on Startartist.


I’m an artist and I’d like to participate in the Startartist project. May I send my candidature even during the crowdfunding campaign?

        Of course, selections are open. Just write to artist@startartist.com


What is the added value when you buy through Startartist?

        The customer buys a work with artistic value; it is unique, original and certified.
       The work’s value will also appreciate in time becoming a possible source of                  investment.


What is the added value by selling works of art through Startartist?

        Artists can sell works of art all over the world obtaining greater visibility. Artists         not yet on the traditional art market will have the possibility of being discovered        by the public.


Are you an Art Gallery?

        Startartist will also become an instrument for galleries because they can use it          to develop their collections! They can discover emerging artists from all over the        world and launch a new artist before anyone else does.
TEAM

Nicola, Paola, Lucia, Stefano


Nicola (33) interior designer

Paola (33) semiologist 


Lucia (29) Art historian and Museologist


Stefano (33) Aerospace Engineer

Immagina un luogo dove poter curiosare tra le opere di artisti provenienti da tutto il mondo, un luogo che raccoglie fotografie, illustrazioni e dipinti che arrivano da ogni parte del globo.
