story:
Was ist „EigenART-Bond"?

Wir, Marisa und Lisa, sind zwei Studentinnen der Hochschule für Künste im Sozialen, in Ottersberg bei Bremen. Wir wollen im Rahmen unseres Berufspraktikums das Projekt „EigenART-Bond. Art Exchange Project“ in Indien durchführen. In diesem Projekt geht es zunächst darum eine Kooperation zwischen der HKS Ottersberg und dem Life Education Centre Auroville herzustellen. Dort vor Ort werden wir im August und September 2014 mit jungen Frauen in einen künstlerischen Austausch gehen. Die indischen Lebensform und deren soziohistorischer Hintergrund sind für uns zu erforschendes Neuland. Wir möchten Indien mit all seinen Facetten kennenlernen und den Menschen, die dort leben, mit Respekt und Interesse begegnen. Wir wollen dazu beitragen, dass diese Frauen selbstbewusster und unabhängiger werden. Die Verbindung des LEC Auroville zu der HKS Ottersberg soll auf beiden Seiten wirken und einen Rahmen für kulturelle Forschung, Austausch und Begegnung ermöglichen.

Wir werden diese Reise mit einer Forschungsfrage antreten, unsere Erfahrungen dokumentieren und unsere Erkenntnisse an unsere Nachfolger weitergeben.

Denn unser Ziel ist, dass auch andere Studenten das Projekt in den Folgejahren weiterführen und für eine nachhaltige Entwicklung und Kooperation sorgen.


What means "EigenART- Bond"?

We, Marisa and Lisa are two students of the University of Applied Sciences and Arts, near Bremen. We want to start an art exchange project, which is called „EigenART-Bond. Art Exchange Project“, carried out in India.

„EigenART“, a german word creation, metaphorically forms a bond between art and the peculiarity of someone.

In August and September 2014, we are going to start an artistic exchange with young women. The indian life style and their socio-historical background are two important aspects of our work, which we are going to explore in Auroville. We want to get to know India with all facets and we will face the indian people with respect and interest. One of our aims is to have a hand in helping these women to become more confident and independent. The connection of the LEC Auroville and the HKS Ottersberg is supposed to allow a framework on both sides for cultural research, exchange and encounter. We want to create a cooperation between the HKS Ottersberg and the Life Education Centre Auroville.

We will make that journey with a research question in our minds, document our experiences and share our findings with our followers. Our purpose is a continous project, which will be carried on in the future by other students and ensure sustainable development and cooperation.


         


Was wir brauchen und was andere davon haben

Wir benötigen eure Unterstützung um unserem Vorhaben einen offiziellen Rahmen zu verschaffen. Hierfür möchten wir einen Verein gründen, der den Grundstein für die Kooperation zwischen der HKS Ottersberg und dem LEC Auroville bilden soll. Dieser wird ein Vereinskonto führen, welches alle gesammelten Gelder enthalten wird. Unsere NachfolgerInnen können in unsere Fußstapfen treten, dem Verein beitreten und somit das Vereinskonto verwalten und benutzen. Mit etwas Glück finden Sie noch etwas Startkapital unserer erworbenen Gelder vor :)

Denn für die künstlerische Arbeit in Auroville möchten wir verschiedene Materialien mitbringen und an das LEC spenden. Neben den Materialkosten fallen einige andere Kosten an, wie z.B.: Unterkunft, Verpflegung, Visum und Flugkosten.

Wir möchten den Menschen, die uns ihr Vertrauen schenken und uns mit so viel Gastfreundlichkeit und Offenheit begegnen, auch etwas zurück geben.

Auch wenn wir nicht den vollen Betrag erreichen werden, können wir jeden Euro gebrauchen. Helft uns unser Projekt wachsen zu lassen!


What we need and what we can offer

We need your support for our project to reach the status of an official framework . Because of this we want to create an association, to form the foundation for the cooperation between the HKS Ottersberg and the LEC Auroville. All money that is connected to the project, will be collected at our association account. Our successors can follow in our footsteps , join the club, manage the association's account and use it. With a little luck they can find a start-up capital of our funds acquired before :)
For the artistic work in Auroville, we want to donate different materials for LEC.

In addition to the material costs there are some other costs , such as: accommodation and catering, visa and flight cost. Even if we will not reach the full amount, we can use every euro.

We thank the Aurovillians for their hospitality, openness and confidence in our work.

Support the growth of our project!


Ziele und Auswirkungen

Mit eurer Unterstützung werden wir nach Indien reisen und im Life Education Centre, Auroville unser Projekt durchführen. Wir werden unsere Erfahrungen dokumentieren und für unsere Bachelorarbeit nutzen. Es wird öffentliche Vorträge im Rahmen der Hochschule geben, in denen wir unsere Erfahrungen an Studierende weitergeben und sich Interessierte direkt informieren und bewerben können. Wir werden den nachfolgenden Studierenden in ihrer Projektplanung und -durchführung begleitend und unterstützend zur Seite stehen.

Goals and impacts

With your support we will go to India and carry out our project in the Life Education Centre, Auroville. We will document our experiences and use them for our bachelor thesis.

We will give public lectures at our university to inform students about our project, report from our experiences and in order to gain new students for the project. It is really important to us to support and accompany the following students during the project.


Andere Wege zu helfen:

Du kannst uns nicht nur über einen Beitrag unterstützen, sondern gerne auch anderen von unserem Projekt erzählen. Teile unseren Indiegogo Film auf Facebook oder anderen Social Communities, damit wir bekannt werden! Falls du uns irgendwie anders helfen möchtest, Fragen oder Ratschläge hast, kannst du uns unter eigenart-bond@gmx.de kontaktieren.

Other ways to help:

If you can not donate contribution, we ask you to talk with others about EigenART! Post our Indiegogo film on Facebook or other social communities so that people notice our project! If you have other ideas to help us, or if you have any questions and advices, please contact us: eigenart-bond@gmx.de.



Danke für eure Unterstützung!        Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Was
ist „EigenART-Bond"?
Wir,
Marisa und Lisa, sind zwei Studentinnen der Hochschule für Künste
im Sozialen, in Ottersberg bei Bremen. Wir wollen im Rahmen unseres
Berufspraktikums das Projekt „EigenART-Bond. Art Exchange
Project“ in Indien durchführen. In diesem Projekt geht es
zunächst darum eine Kooperation zwischen der 
HKS Ottersberg und dem Life Education Centre Auroville herzustellen.
Dort vor Ort werden wir im August und September 2014 mit jungen
Frauen in einen künstlerischen Austausch gehen. 					 Die indischen
Lebensform und deren soziohistorischer Hintergrund sind für uns zu
erforschendes Neuland. Wir möchten Indien mit all seinen Facetten
kennenlernen und den Menschen, die dort leben, mit Respekt und
Interesse begegnen. Wir wollen dazu beitragen, dass diese Frauen
selbstbewusster und unabhängiger werden. Die
Verbindung des LEC Auroville zu der HKS Ottersberg soll auf beiden
Seiten wirken und einen Rahmen für kulturelle Forschung, Austausch
und Begegnung ermöglichen. 

Wir
 werden diese Reise mit einer Forschungsfrage antreten, unsere
Erfahrungen dokumentieren und unsere Erkenntnisse an unsere
Nachfolger weitergeben. 

Denn
unser Ziel ist, dass auch andere Studenten das Projekt in den
Folgejahren weiterführen und für eine nachhaltige Entwicklung und
Kooperation sorgen. 

What
means "EigenART- Bond"?

We, Marisa and Lisa are two students of the University
of Applied Sciences and Arts, near Bremen. We want to start an art
exchange project, which is called  „EigenART-Bond.
Art Exchange Project“, carried
out in India.
„EigenART“,
a
german word creation, metaphorically
forms a
bond between art and the peculiarity of someone.

In
August and September 2014, we are going to start an artistic exchange
with young women. The indian life style and their socio-historical
background are two important aspects of our work, which we are going
to explore in Auroville. We want to get to know India with all facets
and we will face the indian people with respect and interest. One of
our aims is to have a hand in helping these women to become more
confident and independent. The connection of the LEC Auroville and
the
HKS Ottersberg is supposed to allow a framework on both sides for
cultural research, exchange and encounter. We want to create a
cooperation between the HKS Ottersberg and the Life Education Centre
Auroville.
We
will make that journey with a research question in our minds,
document our experiences and share our findings with our followers.
Our purpose is a continous project, which will be carried on in the
future by other students and ensure sustainable development and
cooperation.          Was
wir brauchen und was andere davon habenWir
benötigen eure Unterstützung um unserem Vorhaben einen offiziellen
Rahmen zu verschaffen. Hierfür möchten wir einen Verein gründen,
der den Grundstein für die Kooperation zwischen der HKS Ottersberg
und dem LEC Auroville bilden soll. Dieser wird ein Vereinskonto
führen, welches alle gesammelten Gelder enthalten wird. Unsere
NachfolgerInnen können in unsere Fußstapfen treten, dem Verein
beitreten und somit das Vereinskonto verwalten und benutzen. Mit
etwas Glück finden Sie noch etwas Startkapital unserer erworbenen
Gelder vor :)
Denn
für die künstlerische Arbeit in Auroville möchten wir verschiedene
Materialien  mitbringen und an das LEC spenden. Neben den
Materialkosten fallen einige andere Kosten an, wie z.B.: Unterkunft,
Verpflegung, Visum und Flugkosten. 

Wir
möchten den Menschen, die uns ihr Vertrauen schenken und uns mit so
viel Gastfreundlichkeit und Offenheit begegnen, auch etwas zurück
geben.
Auch
wenn wir nicht den vollen Betrag erreichen werden, können wir jeden
Euro gebrauchen. Helft uns unser Projekt wachsen zu lassen!
What
we need and what we can offer
We
need your support for our project to reach the status of an official
framework . Because of this we want to create an association, to form
the foundation for the cooperation between the HKS Ottersberg and the
LEC Auroville. All money that is connected to the project, will be
collected at our association account. Our successors can follow in
our footsteps , join the club, manage the association's account and
use it. With a little luck they can find a start-up capital of our
funds acquired before :)For the artistic work in Auroville, we
want to donate different materials for LEC.
In
addition to the material costs there are some other costs , such as:
accommodation and catering, visa and flight cost. Even if we will not
reach the full amount, we can use every euro. 


We
thank the Aurovillians for their hospitality, openness and confidence
in our work.


Support
the growth of our project!
Ziele
und Auswirkungen
Mit eurer Unterstützung
werden wir nach Indien reisen und im Life Education Centre, Auroville
unser Projekt durchführen. Wir werden unsere Erfahrungen
dokumentieren und für unsere Bachelorarbeit nutzen. Es wird
öffentliche Vorträge im Rahmen der Hochschule geben, in denen wir
unsere Erfahrungen an Studierende weitergeben und sich Interessierte
direkt informieren und bewerben können. Wir werden den nachfolgenden
Studierenden in ihrer Projektplanung und -durchführung begleitend
und unterstützend zur Seite stehen.

Goals
and impacts 

With
your support we will go to India and carry out our project in the
Life Education Centre, Auroville. We will document our experiences
and use them for our bachelor thesis.

We
will give public lectures at our university to inform students about
our project, report from our experiences and in order to gain new
students for the project. It is really important to us to support and
accompany the following students during the project.

Andere
Wege zu helfen:
Du kannst uns nicht nur
über einen Beitrag unterstützen, sondern gerne auch anderen von
unserem Projekt erzählen. Teile unseren Indiegogo Film auf Facebook
oder anderen Social Communities, damit wir bekannt werden! Falls du
uns irgendwie anders helfen möchtest, Fragen oder Ratschläge hast,
kannst du uns unter eigenart-bond@gmx.de
kontaktieren. 


Other
ways to help: 

If
you can not donate contribution,  we ask you to talk with others
about EigenART! Post our Indiegogo film on Facebook or other social
communities so that people notice our project! If you have other
ideas to help us, or if you have any questions and advices, please
contact us: eigenart-bond@gmx.de.Danke für eure Unterstützung!        Thank you for your support!

story:
Dans le cadre de la fin de mon cursus universitaire aux Beaux Arts de Londres, je souhaite créer un programme de performance durant les 10 jours de l'exposition à Slade Grande Bretagne). Il mettra l'accent sur la façon dont la télévision crée de nouveaux types de performances. 

 Les performances seront crées pour un public acteur et participant soit présent physiquement dans l'espace d'exposition, soit ayant accès en ligne sur site de diffusion. Le thème central sera : l'utilisation de l'esthétique de production du "direct" proposé par la télévision. 

A travers la création d'une mise en scène extravagante, qui représente un studio de télévision, mon ambition est d'élaborer une méthode pour afficher les ressources sociales qui sont associés à, et exigées par la pratique de la production artistique de collaboration et l'articulation du discours public. Grâce à la création d'un programme de 10 jours de performances, mon objectif est de produire des séries TV théâtralisées, talk-shows, jeux télévisés et débats qui bouleversent leur logique initiale, défient les protocoles de communication de masse, les stéréotypes et les promesses de liberté créative et de démocratisation. 

Les conditions d'existence de la performance seront exploitées chaque jour d'une manière différente par la diffusion : interroger l'état du « live », le désir « d’être ensemble au même endroit » en droite ligne du modèle télévisée. L'installation sera composée d'une combinaison d'objets sculpturaux, de plateformes, des performers et des membres de l'audience. Les caméras seront très mobiles mettant le zoom à la fois sur les gens qui travaillent derrière la caméra et sur les participants et le public. 

Les corps dans l'espace transforment l'ensemble des actions et des objets dans la sculpture. Les accessoires laissés après la performance « live » définiront l'espace civique de l'Agora. Le statut de ces objets est déterminé: ils sont des sculptures avant et après le spectacle, ils deviennent des accessoires, des textes ou des caractères pendant l'action et sont exposés indépendamment par la suite.

Le projet que je voudrais créer pour l'exposition à Slade School of Fine Art est un projet ambitieux. J’ai le désir de pousser et challenger ma pratique artistique. Travaillant en collaboration avec des personnes venant de différents horizons, je voudrais être en mesure de payer les performers et de collaborer avec moi. Grâce vos dons, je vais être capable de payer pour les frais de voyage / nourriture des artistes. En outre, en raison de l'exigence technique pour la création et la diffusion en ligne, je vais avoir besoin d'un soutien technique solide et pour cette raison le financement me permettra d'élaborer le projet dans les meilleures conditions. Je suis également en contact avec l'équipe de Grande Bretagne de Gymnastique Rythmique pour que le groupe vienne et d'effectue une performance à l'extérieur de la Slade School of Fine Art, pendant toute la durée de l'exposition. Pour cette raison, à travers ce financement que je pourrais être en mesure de payer leurs frais. Je suis vraiment engagé à rendre le projet prendre vit, malheureusement il ne sera pas possible sans votre soutien.

Focusing on how television creates new kinds of performance, I propose to create a 10-day program of performances running throughout the 10 days of the Slade Degree Show. The performances will be made for an online broadcast audience as well as a live audience. 

I am interested in using the aesthetic of 'live' TV production, as well as creating an extravagant mise-en-scene, which represents a TV studio, as a method to display the social resources that are associated with, and necessitated by, the practice of collaborative artistic production and the articulation of public discourse. Through the creation of a 10-day program of performances, my aim is to produce theatricalised TV series, talk-shows, game-shows and TV debates that overturn their initial logic to theatre which aspires to both challenge and integrate the mass media protocols, its stereotypes and its promise of creative freedom and democratization. 


 The conditions of the performance's existence are exploited each day in a different way through the broadcasting. Questioning the condition of the 'live', the desire to 'be' together, same place - same time, performance opens up to the televised model. The set will consist of a combination of sculptural objects, platforms, performers and audience member. The cameras will be highly mobile, constantly revealing the presence of the people working behind the camera as well as participants, members and audience. 

 The bodies in space transform the ensemble of actions and objects into sculpture. The props left behind after the 'live' performance will reactivate the civic space of the agora. The status of those objects is determined: they are sculptures before and after the performance. They become accessories, texts or characters during the action, but are exhibited independently afterward.

The project I would like to create for the Degree Show at the Slade School of Fine Art is an ambitious project where I will push and challenge my practice. Working in collaboration with people coming from different horizons, I would like to be able to pay for those people to come and collaborate with me. Through founding I will be able to pay for the travel expenses/ food of the performers. Moreover, because of technical requirement of creating an online broadcast I will need a strong technical support and for that reason the founding will help to address the project to the right people. I am also in contact with the TEAM GB of Rhythmic Gymnastic to come and perform on the outside of the Slade School of Fine Art. Throughout the duration of the show, for that reason, with the founding I will be able to pay for their expenses. I am really committed to make the project happen but it won't be happening without supports.

story:
Hello everyone !

I'm Sakuems, a French artist and youtuber ! :)

I've been working as an artist for a couple years and as a way to celebrate my last 2 years of work, i have decided to make an artbook.

I have around 60 artworks from 2014 and 2015.

It's all about girls, flowers and pretty fantasy inspired art.
Most of my pieces are very peaceful and happy, and full of colors :)
This project is very dear to me but i also want to share to the world so i had in mind to made it happen with a crowdfunding campaign ^^

Early birds !

The first 10 people to pledge for the physical book perk (or any combo pack with the artbook) will get a FREE MINI ORIGINAL  (10x15cm - 6"x4") included ! :D

Funding update !


The book !


What i need to complete this project

I have 70% of the work done so far. I'm finishing up the layout but i also need extra time to make even better content based on my last sketches (i would like to have about 5 exclusive pieces). That means getting to 100 pages !

What comes next ? You ! :D

Every single dollar you'll give will be injected into the project and if we get any excess, it will be to fund other artbooks, stories or youtube content :)

I have decided on the lower amount required to get this new project printed. Here's a rough estimation of how the basic funds will be used

• 37% to cover the cost of Printing 50 copies of the artbook

• 25% to cover shipping and packaging cost

• 16% to cover fees (paypal, Indie gogo)

• 22% margin (covers taxes, work time and some extra for future project)

I did my best to lower the cost and offer to all of you various options depending of your budget. You can pick between digital artbook or physical artbook. You can also get some fancy prints with it and/or even get some goodies bag :)

If for some reasons, we can't make it to 1000$, you'll get your money back and i'll work on the project even harder in order for me to launch it again.
Of course, this project still needs works in the next weeks ! remember that this page is where you can pre-order the book and other perks. They will be deliver in February 2016 :)

You have the power !

I already had an artbook printed and sold out last year. My 2013/2014 edition was entirely funded my me (400$) and i got 26 copies made. 26 sold ! I want to get to the next level with this book and print a lot more, so with your help, i can definitely do something bigger, with more content :)

If you like what i do and want to know how i do it, it's the perfect project to pledge for and it's pretty affordable :)

I hope you'll like this project and help me make it happen !

    Risks and Challenges

    Like any project, there's always some risks involded. I do have a back up printing company if anything happens with the first one. I also have settle down everything  in case something happens to me and i can't finish the project - you'll be refund entirely. I'm gonna take care of every single aspect of this project but as i said, it's almost  finished so i'm quite sure this will be happening no matter the issues i might face :)

    There's some risks and challenges related to stretch goals as i'm currently experience costs/shipping/quantities and various supplies needed. The major risk would be related to scheduling, since i need to wait for the products to be shipped and i need time to complete all homemade rewards. That's why the delivery schedule can be extended. Which basically means, if you pick the artbook reward, you will most likely receive it somewhere in january or february. But if we get to the Original Raffle rewards, 25 of you will receive their artbook somewhere in march (so i can make all the art) I'll keep you posted on the releasing date of course.

    You can't pledge but still want to help ?

    I totally understand ! :D you can still do wonders if you simply share this project on your social media websistes or any art forums/place you know there's art lovers.

    Commenting about this, sharing the link of this, talking to your friends. Every thing will matter and you could bring someone here that will pledge for this. You can definitely help me without spending any money :)

    THANK YOU SO MUCH !!

story: Our team of artists were desperate to see an all inclusive arts festival in Nashville; something a little edgier, a little more garage, but something exciting and new. So CultureSmash Nashville was born, a short film festival, live music showcase, and visual arts exhibit all in one place happening on October 17th and 18th! Now we have great bands booked, amazing visual art planned for the gallery, and some fantastic movies from almost every genre. Now all we need to do is market the event, promote, and well "put butts in seats"! That's where you come in! This event is run by actors, filmmakers, and musicians all looking to show that Nashville is more than just country music!
story_txt: Our team of artists were desperate to see an all inclusive arts festival in Nashville; something a little edgier, a little more garage, but something exciting and new. So CultureSmash Nashville was born, a short film festival, live music showcase, and visual arts exhibit all in one place happening on October 17th and 18th! Now we have great bands booked, amazing visual art planned for the gallery, and some fantastic movies from almost every genre. Now all we need to do is market the event, promote, and well "put butts in seats"! That's where you come in! This event is run by actors, filmmakers, and musicians all looking to show that Nashville is more than just country music!

story:
They were but a few feet from each other, they stood still; wary; alert, their weapons at the ready. They stared intensely, peering into each other's souls, the hatred exuding from their bodies, the fire burning passionately in their eys. They would only ever meet on the battlefield, faceless, nameless, anonymous; they are opponents; adversaries, rivals. They will fight to the death.
They are "Mortal Enemies"

Michael Kontraros Collectibles is company dedicated to producing and selling high quality figures for collectors, sculptors and painters.

This new product range will be purely Historical and will feature high quality 75mm figures portraying soldiers from opposing sides - same rank and same battle. The figures will be sold separately but the pairs will be released simultaneously.

After an extensive selection of fantasy figures Michael Kontraros Collectibles has taken a brave step into the world of Historical Figures.  This immaculately detailed product range will feature high quality 75mm figures focusing on combatants from various eras, wars and battles. Wars have been unfortunately fought throughout time, however the uniforms, armor, heraldry and art of war remains to this day spectacular. The "Mortal Enemies" project will introduce modelers to the two sides of each war, we will carefully select interesting, colourful and exciting themes that will inspire modelers to paint, read and learn! 

Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figure to be molded, copied, packaged and released.

French and Prussian officer

Sculpted and Painted by Christos Panagiotopoylos

Art Direction: Michael Kontraros

The Franco-Prussian lasted from July 19th 1870 to May 10th 1871 and was fought between the German states of the North German Confederation led by the Kingdom of Prussia and the Second French Empire of Napoleon III. Essentially the war started due to the ambitions of Prussia to unify Germany which resulted in fears within France about a shift of balance and power within Europe.

Amidst growing tensions and concerns on July 16th 1870, the French parliament voted to declare war on the German Kingdom of Prussia. Surprisingly the conflict began three days later with Germany invading northeastern France, with the French being caught unprepared.

After a series of swift victories by German forces throughout France, Paris finally fell on January 28th 1871.

Further to winning the war Germany became a unified country and with the signing of the treaty of Frankfurt acquired the majority of Alsace and certain areas of Lorraine.

With the balance of power shifting considerably in Europe and Otto von Bismarck demanding great authority within Europe the foundations for World War I were laid.

story:
Jean Daddy is a Kitchener, Ontario garage rock band that finds joy and comfort in noise. Taking influences from new and old styles of garage, punk, and post-punk, the four-piece never make songs longer than 2 minutes. The shorter, the better.

We're raising money to create a 4 minute music video, shot on location in Kitchener with local filmmakers and artists. We have the dream team, we just need the funds! 

Jeandaddy.bandcamp.com

https://www.facebook.com/jeandaddy/

We have the dream team, we just need the funds! Jeandaddy.bandcamp.comhttps://www.facebook.com/jeandaddy/

story:
WHO ARE THE CANNERS 

The canners of NYC are autonomous workers who earn a living by collecting cans and bottles to be recycled. Through their selective collection activity they greatly contribute to recycling in the city. 'Canning' is also crucial for their livelihoods. However, they are not officially recognized as workers, which puts them in a vulnerable and marginalized situation.  

WHAT IS THIS PROJECT

> SURE WE CAN is the only non-for-profit redemption center in NYC. It provides a safe space for canners to redeem cans and bottles for 5cents each. SWC is collaborating with Pimp My Carroça to promote this Pimpex NY edition. 

> PIMP MY CARROÇA is a social, cultural and environmental project to promote visibility, respect and security for waste pickers/canners/recyclers. It started in Brazil where artist Thiago Mundano promoted a collective action to reform and paint the waste pickers' carts and provide equipment to the workers. 

> PIMPEX is a micro version of this project that can be adapted and situated in different contexts. We want to bring this action to support canners in New York City! 

WHAT WE PROPOSE 

For this Pimpex NY edition we will reform the carts of 3 canners and provide them with safety equipment. 

Reform and paint the carts > Artists will work with the canners in order to improve their carts, promoting their visibility and the value of their work. 

Provide safety equipment > To support their everyday work canners will receive a package that includes rain-cloths, gloves, rope, glasses, flashlight, bags, shirt with reflective band. 

MEET THE THREE CANNERS

AND THE ARTISTS WHO WILL PARTICIPATE

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN

In order for this action to hit the ground we need a total of $900 to reform 3 carts and to be able to give equipment to 3 canners. This is how we'll use the money:

THE IMPACT

Our goal is to improve these canners' working conditions and promote recognition for their activity through art and participatory action! This is one first step we can take to promote an inclusionary dialogue about the situation of canners in New York City. 

GET INVOLVED!

We need your support to make this happen! 

You can get involved by: 

> contributing to this crowdfunding, 

> sharing the campaign, 

> joining us for the Pimpex NY event!

The Pimpex NY event is planned to happen on 9th April 2016 at Sure We Can. Check SWC Facebook page and get in touch with us for more information.

OUR PERKS

story:
A Radio Caravan for Shouting Fire!

 

First, what is Shouting Fire?

Shouting Fire is an independent, international broadcasting collective, born on the playa and inspired by Burning Man. We are dedicated to radical audio expression.  Our goal is the free flow of information, music, art and culture. We seek to connect the community across the globe all year long and spread our values to the world outside of  Burning Man.

We are an open source, non-commercial,  community radio station, operated entirely by volunteers.  Many of us have been bringing you radio in Black Rock City for the last 20 years or so. Currently the collective numbers over 50 people in 10 countries on 4 continents .  We are your friends, neighbours and campmates, we have deep roots on the playa. We are your community.
We bring listeners live broadcasts from Burning Man events and Burning Man inspired events from around the world as well as weekly music and informational programs from Burners across the globe.  We've built a Global Burner Radio Network to keep you connected year round.

At regional events where there is  an existing radio station we collaborate with them and carry their programming.  If there is no radio station, we bring one! We have the equipment to broadcast over FM at the event and stream it to the world over the internet  or at the very least record for later internet broadcast.

We are able to add a very participatory element to an event as we also give people and projects at the burns an additional vehicle to get their stories out to the community.  In addition we have daily slots available for those who want to have their own radio shows. We provide you access to the airwaves.  By streaming the broadcast to the world, we are able to connect Burners across the globe.

In the US we recently brought listeners live broadcasts from SNRG (The Southern Nevada Regional Gathering), Flipside in Texas and Lakes of Fire, The Great Lakes Regional Burn with plans for more in development.  We also brought listeners simulcasts from Burning Seed in Australia and from Radio Free Tankwa at Afrikaburn. In Europe we did live broadcasts from the Burning Man European Leadership Summit in Denmark as well as The Burning Ball in Vienna and in France, Paris Pre-Decompression

A Radio Caravan!!

We now want to cover more and more European events and that’s where the Caravan comes into play. Doing radio in the desert or anywhere for that matter, if you don’t have a proper space is not a piece of cake. You need a little shelter from the noise and wind, dust and sand.  Plus the gear generates heat and needs to be kept cool

Enter the mobile radio caravan studio (aka The Caravan of Love).  We traveled to South Africa for Afrikaburn this year to work with our friends at Radio Free Tankwa who gave us the idea.  Our caravan will be based in Europe and be towed to numerous events.
We found and old caravan that is perfect for the job.  Labor to convert it and get it fitted for our needs has been donated.  We are asking for the community for help in buying it paying for the materials.  To make this a reality we need to raise 700 Euros ($785).

Since we are volunteer run and self funded,  all of our radio gear is either donated by collective members  or we use our personal gear. Radio gear is not cheap so any funds raised over the goal will go towards additional gear (speakers, mics, cables, etc).  

Check us out on Facebook and look at our website located at ShoutingFire.com AND of course tune in.  You can listen on our website (yes we have apps for iOS and Android, links on our site). We are also carried on Tune In Radio, iHeart Radio and the Radio Garden app).

So, if you like the idea of us bringing you live broadcasts from European burns and events and helping to  spread Burning Man vibes and values to the world, give us a little help! Your support is greatly appreciated.

story:
What is Lusio. A Night to Awaken?
​

Lusio. A Night to Awaken is a one night only, free, family friendly event where 20-30 light art installations are set throughout Volunteer Park for all to explore. Lusio is not just a celebration of light and sound; Lusio is a chance to playfully explore a delicate and fleeting art form curated directly into the lush nature of the Pacific Northwest. Thousands of people flock to the historic park for a magical evening unlike any other in Seattle.
Relax - Wonder - Wander - Play - Explore 

 

Why Lusio? ​

  • To provide an opportunity for light artists to have their work shown in a public setting. 

Most light art is shown in a gallery, at a festival, or at a private event. Rarely does this form of art get a real chance to be seen by the public eyes of Seattle and never has it been showcased in such a large setting. Lusio provides artists the opportunity to get their work seen and voices heard by a wide demographic of people in curated but playful setting. 

  • To make light art accessible.

This form of art has started to arrive and percolate in the Pacific Northwest, but only if you attend an event like Burning Man or the new Seattle Arts Fair, both which cost money to attend.
Lusio is a free family friendly event making it available to any person of any demographic that wants to attend and have their senses delighted and inspired.  
Art should be accessible to everyone! 

  • To Spread Happiness in Bulk.  To Engage. To Play!

To quote Heraclitus, "Lifetime is a child at play, moving pieces in a game. Kingship belongs to the child." With all the advances in technology that make this type of art possible, it's easy to forget technology and art can also be playful. 

Playfulness has been proven to decrease stress, improve brain function, stimulate creativity, promote connections, improve social skills, and positive well being. 



Funding Lusio


Lusio is not a quick pop up exhibit. Lusio takes almost the full year to plan and execute properly. 
Lusio is funded  with a partial Tech Specific Grant from 4Culture (Thank you 4Culture!) and the rest of the funding comes from the pockets of the artists and Lusio curator. Last year it costed approximately $11,000 to produce this event, and we did it with less than $3,000 in community donations. The artists and curator spend quite a lot of their own money funding these installations, many of which are created just for Lusio. 

Paying the artists
Lusio has been lucky enough to have artists willing to donate their time and art to the greater good of the event, but these artists deserve to be paid for all their hard work making people happy. 

The majority of the donations will be going directly into a fund to pay the artists a stipend for their time!

Our goal is to raise at least $5000 to give stipends of $100-$300 per artist. 
This is not much of a stipend but with 30 installations we need a minimum of $3,000 to pay the artists a minimum $100 stipend. And since a guy raised $55,000 for potato salad, surely we can raise $5000 to help pay the artists ;) 
 

New perks will be added though out the campaign, make sure to check back!


Your donations will also go towards Lusio production which includes but is not limited to the following... 

  • 30+ generators rentals
  • Van/Truck rentals
  • Permits, insurances, licenses
  • Marketing- promotional materials, website, ad's
  • Graphic Design
  • Signage for Lusio booth
  • Free glowing gifts for children
  • Sound Equipment rentals
  • AV rentals (projectors mainly) 


 

See what Seattle is saying about Lusio!

See full article HERE




 
 


Other Ways You Can Help

TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS ABOUT LUSIO!
If you can't contribute today, but would like to help in the second best way possible,

RSVP ON FACEBOOK AND INVITE EVERYONE YOU KNOW!
 

VOLUNTEER
We need volunteers of all kinds. Please sign up to Volunteer HERE or email lusiolight@gmail.com

story:
Veiculo SUr

A project by Laboratorio: Condensacion  and PLUSbrasil

Concept: Mercado Invisible/Invisible market, we are working with intangible values, as long we are creating ciculation of gifts (of several kinds) we create an economy, increase value, give-recive.

In terms of mobility, we are carrying a feedback with us,  from south to north, promoting a voice from those cultural experiences that grow in the south hemispher within a global excercise.

Using artistic tools to create an interfase among public space, its users and its visitors. People and its economy before objects and paper.

Travelling from souht to north, creating a path that other will walk after us, with they´re own inmaterial and material objects to give, and bodies to recive.

This loop of the circuit, the first passengers of the veículo, we choose to work with Mercados sobre ruedas/Feiras livres/street markets. A social structure where exchange happens in several levels beyond the money-product trade. A weaving of a comunity, time frame, colored streets, diversion of transit, etc...

Experiencing a situation, the body within a social situation, move by exchange dynamics.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to make the encounter possible, the meeting of people in social situations, has a lot of  value in this times of digital comunications and insolation.

We will invest the resources in travels and video/sound/body register of this diferent enviroments, then we share with you the results through diferent media: video, tracks, performances and exhibits.

Resources are distributed equaly to 3 stops for the veículo, Chile, México, Brazil.

We can also take you for a tour in one of the markets we are visiting in case you live or are visiting Santiago de Chile, Mexico City, Sao Paulo Brazil or Munich Germany.

We can credit you in social networks and for mayor contributers (from $500 u.s) we can credit you in our promoting materials for our events and enconunters.

The Impact

We can comunicate diferent ways of social engegement, and economy that the Market doesnt want to enbrace, but the people does as a way of socializing, trade, live or resist. 

Promoting the value of intangible exchange brings back the focus to the people and their ways, lit the public space as a common space for meet, dialogue, create, live, update and share.

Risks & Challenges

The Challenge in this project is to create mobilit from south to north, but also to bring some lenguaje in to the arena of the western vision of the world, in a very hegemonic conditions, we dear to create speech and to show other ways of thinking.

Maybe the Market doesn´t want to hear or see us but we have the will to do it, and we experience our own resistance and others. We have to speak, and register what is valuable for us, how we can engage, how we can dialoogue.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!!!

Muchas Gracias, Agradecidos, Thank you so much!

Promoting the value of intangible exchange brings back the focus to the people and their ways, lit the public space as a common space for meet, dialogue, create, live, update and share.

Risks & Challenges
The Challenge in this project is to create mobilit from south to north, but also to bring some lenguaje in to the arena of the western vision of the world, in a very hegemonic conditions, we dear to create speech and to show other ways of thinking.
Maybe the Market doesn´t want to hear or see us but we have the will to do it, and we experience our own resistance and others. We have to speak, and register what is valuable for us, how we can engage, how we can dialoogue.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word!!!
Muchas Gracias, Agradecidos, Thank you so much!

story:
MoonShine Bar

MoonShine Bar is our second The Golden Guy art bar.  Each bar is an interactive, community based art project on it's own.  Last year we built the Crow Bar, a huge success, intense fun with profound encounters .  This year we are inspired by the heavens and the entrepreneurial spirit of back woods distillers.  Our mission is to provide intimate and outrageous lunar connections and conversations by creating a small, but transcendent lunar environment in which we provide fun and inspiring nightly programs.  

Us

MoonShine Bar is being created by a pod in the WeCharge! (used to be beeCharge!!!) camp.  The camp has a long history of bringing incredible community and experiential art projects to the Playa.  We're artists, performers, builders, servers, organizers and fun lovers.

Your Support

Practically, your support for MoonShine Bar will go towards building materials, art supplies, and transportation costs to and from the Playa.  More importantly, your support enables us to bring real, serious and down to earth "lunacy" to everyone at Burning Man.   

The Golden Guy and MoonShine Bar

The Golden Guy is modeled after a small and eclectic neighborhood called Golden Gai bars in Shinjuku, Tokyo.   Each of the bars is only 8’x12’, guaranteeing intimate experiences for all patrons.  Last year we had five bars, this year closer to two dozen, each very offering unique intimate experiences.

MoonShine Bar is inspired by the full moon that will rise the first night of Burning Man.  The bar roof will have a linear opening that tracks the path of the moon through the night sky, lighting the bar with natural moon light.  From the outside,  MoonShine Bar will appear as a backwoods still.  But, when you enter, you step from Black Rock Kentucky to the surface of the moon, looking back at our own planet earth.  If you look closely, you can see the Black Rock Desert. 

Throughout the week, MoonShine Bar will be the "lunacy" hub, including the MoonShine cocktail, (with real moonshine, of course), moonwalking contests, flat earth theories, toasts to Yuri Gagarin, extra terrestrial DJs, videos, and so much more ...the skies the limit. 

Thank You

First, and most importantly, we hope to see you in the MoonShine Bar!  We will be profoundly grateful for anything you can contribute to our project.  If this inspires you in any way we would love for you to share it.  You can track progress on the MoonShine Bar on our Facebook page.  Here is a link to The Golden Guy.

story:
*English

March 16, 2014

Quito, Ecuador

 In a three-hour conversation, I told my parents “I’m gay.” Accompanied by my sisters, I documented the event in the experimental photography project “Unveiled.”

In the planning process, the reality of Unveiled both excited and unnerved me. At 28, the possibility of rejection by my conservative Catholic, Ecuadorian parents, was one of many potential risks. My parents needed to be comfortable. I wanted to document natural reactions.

I needed to desensitize them to cameras. Much preparation was in order.

So… I prepared.

I photographed them cooking, brushing their teeth, shaving, smoking, and watching soap operas. I photographed them walking, tying their shoes, waking up, working in the office. I photographed my mother doing her nails.

The preparation for the project, surprisingly, plays an integral role in the actual project: coming out to my family at a dinner table, with three cameras, each shooting every five seconds.

The finished product provides the viewer a series of images, each telling a different story of the family they portray, the way those members interact, and ultimately, a photographer Unveiled.T

To find out more about Unveiled:

www.unveiledtheproject.com

A few months ago, I applied for ‘Unveiled’ to have its first solo exhibition in a charming gallery at the Hyller Art Space, Washington DC. I was fortunate enough to be chosen amongst hundreds of applicants to have an exhibition open to the public from the 4th of November till 17th of December 2016.

Hyller Art Space is a non-profit art space dedicated to feature young upcoming artists like myself. Hyller Art Space has offered me their space and the publicity for Unveiled to have its first solo exhibition.

Unfortunately, I will have to cover certain costs:

-Printing and Framing

- Shipping of art work back and forth from London to Washington DC.

- Travel

-Accommodation

- Potential promotional material such as books

- Food and Other expenses

 

After its release, Unveiled has been published on many international platforms. Through this, I have had people contact me from around the world to share their stories. It is humbling for me to see how Unveiled has given people strength in their own process of acceptance, and more importantly, how some have even considered coming out to their own family. After the unfortunate events that took place in Orlando where 49 LGBT people lost their lives, I believe that now more then ever, stories of acceptance need to be shown. It is for this reason that I would like Unveiled to be shared on as many platforms as possible. Through this funding campaign, my aim is to be able to raise funds to make Unveiled’s first exhibition happen. The campaign will run during August and September with the aim of raising enough funds to make the exhibition happen.

I would greatly appreciate any donations made, and kindly share with friends and family.

*Español

16 de de marzo de, 2014

Quito, Ecuador

En una conversación de tres horas, le dije a mis padres: "Que soy gay". Acompañado por mis hermanas, documente el momento en un proyecto de fotografía experimental que lo llame ‘Unveiled’.

En el proceso de planificación, la realidad de contarles la verdad a mis papas me emocionaba y al mismo tiempo me asustaba. A los 28 años, la posibilidad de rechazo por parte de mis padres católicos , fue uno de los muchos riesgos potenciales. Mis padres tenían que estar cómodos. Quería documentar reacciones naturales.

Para eso necesitaba desensibilizarles a las cámaras. Mucha preparación estaba en orden. Así que ... me prepare.

Les fotografié cocinando, cepillándose los dientes, afeitándose, viendo telenovelas. Amarrándose los zapatos, despertándose, trabajando en la oficina.

La preparación para el proyecto, de manera sorprendente, desempeña un papel integral en el proyecto actual: contar a mis padres que soy gay alrededor de una mesa, con tres cámaras que disparan a cada cinco segundos.

El producto terminado ofrece al espectador una serie de imágenes, cada uno contando una historia diferente de la familia que retratan, la forma en que interactúan los miembros, y en última instancia, un fotógrafo sin velo.

para enterarse más acerca de Unveiled. Visita:

www.unveiledtheproject.com

Hace unos meses,  aplique para que mi proyecto fotográfico ‘Unveiled’ tuviese su primera exposición individual en una galería en el centro de Washington DC. Entre cientos fui escogida para tener una exposición abierta al público desde el 4 de noviembre hasta el 17 de de diciembre de de 2016.

Hyller Art Space es un espacio de arte sin fines de lucro dedicada a ofrecer artistas como yo oportunidades nuevas para exponer su obra. La Galería me ha ofrecido su espacio y la publicidad para mi primera exposición individual. Pero desafortunadamente, voy a tener que cubrir ciertos costos:

-Imprimir Y Enmarcación

- Envío de obras de arte desde y hasta Washington DC

- Viaje

- Alojamiento

-Material promocional, tales como libros , tarjetas de presentación.

-Comida y otros gastos

Después del lanzamiento de Unveiled he tenido la suerte que haya sido publicado en muchas plataformas internacionales. A través de esto, he tenido a mucha gente alrededor del mundo que me ha contactado para compartirme su historia. Me enorgullece mucho ver como mediante mi historia la gente ha tomado fuerza en su propio proceso de aceptación y hasta algunos han considerado contarles a su propia familia. Después de los lamentables acontecimientos que tuvieron lugar en Orlando, donde 49 personas LGBT perdieron la vida, creo que ahora más que nunca, historias de aceptación deben ser mostradas.

 

Es por esta razón que mi deseo es compartir ‘Unveiled’ en tantas plataformas como sea posible. Además de esta razón sería un sueño mío verlo en una galería. A través de esta campaña de crowdfunding, mi objetivo es recaudar fondos para poder viajar a Washington DC y llevar acabo esta exposición. La campaña se desarrollará durante agosto y Septiembre con el objetivo de recaudar fondos suficientes.

Les agradecería mucho cualquier donación hecha, y la amabilidad de compartir con amigos y familiares.

story:
WHO WE ARE

CAKE (Contemporary Art Keen Enthusiast ltd), is an Art Magazine/Blog, for visual artists in both trade and consumer.  It taps into the enigma of the art world, featuring interview-based articles, with a diverse range of accredited artists showcasing their works from around the world.  As part of the branding, a portrait of every artist is featured, with a cake.  The magazine is informative, elegantly curated, however with an arty and creative edge.  It is entertaining, drawing in readership as a visual arts information hub for people aspiring to own original works of art or working in the world of modern art.  We are currently working towards expanding our creative team and reach a larger audience. 

CAKE is also an art gallery that sells artworks by some of our featured artists online, in a hired gallery space and/or at prominent art fairs.  To view CAKE magazine/blog please click on the link contemporaryartkeenenthusiast.com 

Founded 26 months ago, CAKE has reached almost 2 million views – this has been achieved with daily marketing with CAKE’s social media platforms and the magazine. 

With currently have 40 artists featured to date with over 40,000 words.

 

ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN

OUR STORY; WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION SUPPORTS

Twenty-Nine years ago, whilst strolling through a market on the outskirts of rural Johannesburg, South Africa, I stumbled upon some sculptures made of burnt clay.  The artist was sitting on the ground in the dirt with his work.  He had burnt the clay with an open fire, the expressive and yet simple shapes and lines in his work took my breath away.  It reminded me of a combination of the works of art by Henry Moore and Francis Bacon.  I wanted to purchase one of his clay effigies that I found particularly striking.  I asked the price, "R250.00" he said, looking up at me, expecting me to haggle him down.  To his surprise I paid him the money he asked and told him I thought he was a genius and walked away.  To this day I regret not taking a note of his name and contact details, I often think about him and what became of him. 


With CAKE, we highlight new talent and established artists are brought to the attention of art lovers and to popular culture around the world. Whether they are an up and coming painter, an award-winning sculptor, an innovative young performance artist, or contemporary film director, we interview and write about their careers and challenges. We give them a platform in the spotlight, to inspire and communicate; an arts hub for all working in the world of modern art.

 

 

Delivered by:

  • Art magazine/blog: CAKE’s intensive and unique interviewing style, with currently 40 featured artists in the magazine with over 40,000 words
  • Creative portraits of featured artists: Creative Photography, art direction to deliver portraits of the artists with a cake to accompany their interview
  • An information hub: Daily promotions on different social media platforms, highlighting the interviews, artists and artworks 
  • Online Art gallery, selling art: Highlighting art for sale on our social media platforms, exhibitions and events, in a hired gallery space and art fairs, to promote and inspire. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

WHAT YOU GET

What CAKE will offer you in return, is sponsorship, your brand and logo affiliated with the art world.  We have worked out how you can benefit from supporting us with this sponsorship synergy linking the world of artists and upmarket readers aspiring to own original works of art, or working in the world of modern art with you or your business brand.

 

How your money will be spent, our key set performance aims:

  • Build the creative team, hire and collaborate with more photographers, journalists, art directors, film makers, proof readers, assistants and website experts
  • Introduce CAKE to more galleries for their involvement 
  • Focus on expanding our roster of artists and their interviews from around the world
  • Work towards a print version of the magazine
  • Create events, hire gallery spaces for exhibitions, and stands at International art fairs to sell artworks 
  • Hiring a PR and a promotional company to approach the media for the magazine, events and exhibitions

 

Marketing costs

  • Social Media: Paid promotions 
  • Web hosting costs
  • Events: Events organiser, catering, photographer and suppliers
  • Art Fairs: Cost of stands and galleries

 

 

MY EXPERIENCE

  • My name is Antoinette Haselhorst I am an experienced art director, photographer and designer
  • Editorial Photographer in Portraits and Fashion since 1990  
  • Art Director in advertising for nine years 1980 - 1989 
  • Author of two published photographic books
  • Several exhibitions of my work.
  • Experience working for a major Newspaper 
  • Relations with art galleries, sponsors and media. 
  • Published two Books: Reflections on Nelson Mandela: icon of peace published by Titan Books. Motherhood sponsored by De Beers; with both projects I worked with high profile A-List celebrities, press and TV.

 

Risks & Challenges

A team is important for CAKE. The magazine is online and not in print and continually needs regular exposure on social media daily and regular website maintenance payments and updates. Managing the magazine and online gallery,  a team on the website who have to be paid when problems arise.  Interviews, writing articles, art directors, photography, social media marketing, networking, sales and design. The team is small and we work very closely with the artists and the art galleries, their associates and staff with all aspects of journalism and content, before, during and after publishing. 

We want to expand our creative team in the magazine and for this we need more funds, covering the expenses for staff and running costs.

Relations with art galleries, sponsors and media.

The team is small and we work very closely with the artists and the art galleries, their associates and staff with all aspects of journalism and content, before, during and after publishing. We want to expand our creative team in the magazine and for this we need more funds, covering the expenses for staff and running costs.

story:
My name is Lance Turner, and I am an artist living and working in Memphis, TN. I graduated from Memphis College of Art in 2007, and I got my MFA at Savannah College of Art and Design in 2012. I make process based paintings that include the viewer in their narrative. I’m also a portrait painter and a muralist.

Over the past couple of years, I have been showing my work primarily throughout the South.

  • I have been included in the South issue of New American Paintings. 
  • I have created a three room installation as the first Studio Resident at Crosstown Arts in Memphis, TN. The installation was about infinity, and included a room surrounded by a tiled mural, progressively smaller versions of that room, video loops, mirror rooms, and repeating patterns. 
  • I showed an installation at ArtFields in Lake City, SC. It was an installation that was based on the viewer’s perspective. It was made up of lenticular prints, mirrors, and tiled paintings that carried visual movement constantly throughout the space.
  • I helped paint a mural at the Memphis Brooks Museum of Art with Nosey and Birdcap that was inspired by video games. It remains on display over a year later.
  • I painted a mural for the Burke Arts Council in Morganton, NC.

I have always wanted to reach a national audience with my artwork, and for the first time I have just been presented with the opportunity to work outside of the South.

I was just accepted to go to the Vermont Studio Residency in Johnson, Vermont for 4 weeks starting November 20th. This residency will give me the time and studio space I need to be an artist. I will have a place to focus on new ideas, and work with 3 advisors who happen to be some of my favorite living artists! In this residency, I want to hone in on some of the ideas that I have been working with for the past two years, and make new body of work that is more focused on a clear goal. Although, a large part of it will be to just make art all day, and not have to worry about space and work. 

Lately, I have been living in a house with nowhere to put a painting. It has been hard to make paintings because I have to rearrange my living room just to build a canvas. This residency will be a great vacation from that, and I will use my time there to its fullest potential by taking risks as an artist, and possibly making a big mess.

I have cut some of the costs of this program with two scholarships, and I made a first payment. Yet it would be very hard for me to come up with the rest of this money in a month. With your generous support, I will be able to create work in an environment where my only job is to create work. Please help me fund the rest of my tuition in exchange for 8x10 paintings and prints.

Your support will help me fully realize all that this residency has to offer. It will offer a new place and new people to help guide my work to another level, whatever it may be.

Your help will be very much appreciated, and I look forward to sharing my work and progress with you!

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share on Facebook!
story_txt:
My name is Lance Turner, and I am an artist living and working in Memphis, TN. I graduated from Memphis College of Art in 2007, and I got my MFA at Savannah College of Art and Design in 2012. I make process based paintings that include the viewer in their narrative. I’m also a portrait painter and a muralist.
Over the past couple of years, I have been showing my work primarily throughout the South.

I have been included in the South issue of New American Paintings. 
I have created a three room installation as the first Studio Resident at Crosstown Arts in Memphis, TN. The installation was about infinity, and included a room surrounded by a tiled mural, progressively smaller versions of that room, video loops, mirror rooms, and repeating patterns. 
I showed an installation at ArtFields in Lake City, SC. It was an installation that was based on the viewer’s perspective. It was made up of lenticular prints, mirrors, and tiled paintings that carried visual movement constantly throughout the space.
I helped paint a mural at the Memphis Brooks Museum of Art with Nosey and Birdcap that was inspired by video games. It remains on display over a year later.
I painted a mural for the Burke Arts Council in Morganton, NC.

I have always wanted to reach a national audience with my artwork, and for the first time I have just been presented with the opportunity to work outside of the South.
I was just accepted to go to the Vermont Studio Residency in Johnson, Vermont for 4 weeks starting November 20th. This residency will give me the time and studio space I need to be an artist. I will have a place to focus on new ideas, and work with 3 advisors who happen to be some of my favorite living artists! In this residency, I want to hone in on some of the ideas that I have been working with for the past two years, and make new body of work that is more focused on a clear goal. Although, a large part of it will be to just make art all day, and not have to worry about space and work. 
Lately, I have been living in a house with nowhere to put a painting. It has been hard to make paintings because I have to rearrange my living room just to build a canvas. This residency will be a great vacation from that, and I will use my time there to its fullest potential by taking risks as an artist, and possibly making a big mess.
I have cut some of the costs of this program with two scholarships, and I made a first payment. Yet it would be very hard for me to come up with the rest of this money in a month. With your generous support, I will be able to create work in an environment where my only job is to create work. Please help me fund the rest of my tuition in exchange for 8x10 paintings and prints.
Your support will help me fully realize all that this residency has to offer. It will offer a new place and new people to help guide my work to another level, whatever it may be.
Your help will be very much appreciated, and I look forward to sharing my work and progress with you!
 
 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools and share on Facebook!

story:
S-T-R-E-T-C-H GOAL!

If we reach $4000, here are some more perks I'll have for everyone who helped:

• A supporters-only three-hour teleseminar on how to surf our changing landscape of technology, privacy, health, and creative living – an open conversation in which I'll share my research and invite your questions for moderated group discussion.

• A free download of my forthcoming double-disc live album to all supporters.  It's a collection of highlights from some of my strongest sets yet (including Burning Man, Rootwire, and Unitus Festivals), groovier, wilder, and more passionate and dynamic than ever.

• A free pdf eBook from scans of my favorite sketchbook pages, 2004 - 2013.  The chronicle of my development as an artist and illustrator – and many, many deep thoughts scrawled in the margins...

Thank you for your support!

About This Campaign:

Q: What is the difference between a weapon and an instrument? 
A: How it's used.

Google selected me on the basis of this tweet to be one of the first few thousand people with access to their new wearable computer, which allow me to share my work more fluidly than ever before.  Since I'm dedicated to exploring the intersection of art, science, and spirituality – and since this device is at the center of so many important controversies about our modern age – I want to use this chance to inspire and empower as many people as possible by making my life a work of art...as well as to examine its potential risks and share my findings with the community.

Part of this will come as a series of essays on how Glass fits into the Big Picture of the evolution of life on Earth – and how our sense of self is changing as we become increasingly intimate with our machines.  Hopefully these essays will help a generation of digital natives navigate their world with more care, discernment, wonder, and respect. Here is the first in that series:

"The Evolution of Surveillance, Part 1: From Burgess Shale To Google Glass"

Organizing my thoughts for The Long-Delayed Book!


I'm also working on a series of firsthand views into my life as an acoustic-electronic musician, live painter, and awestruck naturalist – as well as the work of other inspiring people:

Message To Your Future Self, Part 3: Burning Man 2013


Projecting Through Glass onto stage at Gratifly 2013 (video by Morphis Art)

Rootwire 2013 Live Art Mural Through Glass

And I'm wide open to YOUR ideas for what I could be doing with Glass.  If you have a question you want answered or a perspective you want explored, email me and I'll try and find a way to work it into this campaign.

The money I'm trying to raise is just enough to cover the costs I incurred to pick up the Glass in New York ($1600 for the device, $800 to make the one-week trip) and have just enough left over to to help with bills so I can publish my best work yet for free.

Please support this project with your donations if you can.  Even if you're as broke as I am you can still help by sharing it (share buttons above!) with anyone who believes in technology's potential to empower and not merely enslave us. Thank you for your support!

The Perks

In addition to various interactive offerings (including first-person guitar and art lessons, private concerts, and original artwork) I have a ton of art for people who support this campaign.

Here is the limited-series Creation Skateboards deck for the $80 level only:

Here is the set of three pins available to patrons at the $55 level only:

Here are pictures of the vinyl stickers and limited edition brass pin I'm distributing to supporters who make a donation of $20 (music & stickers), $50 (music, stickers, & pin), or more (exceptions above):

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Danielle Alexander, and I am a Master of Landscape Architecture student at the University of Virginia. For three months this summer, I will be working in a landscape architecture and urban design firm in the Swiss pre-alps. I will be spending weekends painting in the town of Rougemont, with trips to Bern, Paris, Milan, and other cities. As I travel, I will document urban and rural scenes, with a focus on the intersections of public and private space.  I love to sketch and photograph, but nothing is more satisfying to me than to paint on site. I also have several cameras, and I will be shooting medium format film on my twin lens Yashica-D camera. As a landscape architect and urban designer, my interests are centered on the built environment and its inhabitants, and I expect them to be the subject of many of my artworks.

The image above shows a few selections from my painting and drawing work completed at Harvard University. I intend to update this with some of my photography samples as well.

The funding I am seeking will provide the required materials (film, paints, charcoals, canvas, watercolor press, pencils, sketchbooks, etc), material transport costs (extra luggage or special shipping for paintings), as well as the cost of travel in and around Switzerland. I have covered my costs to Switzerland as well as living expenses.

All doners will receive a postcard with a handsketch by the artist while I am travelling, and paintings will be shipped once I return to the US. If you choose to donate an amount not listed or there is a type or size of artwork you desire, anything can be negotiated. 

Please share this with friends and family.

story:
Birds 4 Laos

An environmental art installation consisting of 1000 paper birds to hang in the Bokeo forest.

Acting as protection, and a reminder that all created things are impermanent.

 

In Buddhism, the relationship between culture and ecology is integral to its teachings.

Buddhist teachings give rise to an environmental ethic, with concern for nature; of which man is part. The relationship between culture and ecology can be found in much Buddhist scripture. It is this concept which has informed the creation of this installation. The monks and nuns who live in close proximity to nature stress that care and goodwill should be shown to plants and trees. Buddhists see the forest as one of their closest connections to the teachings of Buddha; who it is believed was born, enlightened and passed away under a tree.

.

Buddhism emphasizes ecological values through a compassion for all beings, or all forms of life. Buddhism views people as part of nature and this realisation that we are all connected to each other and not separate from nature is a solution which should enable us to live a life in harmony with nature. By abusing the environment we in turn abuse ourselves. Therefore pursing peaceful actions rather than harmful ones, leads to all entities benefitting. This prevailing mindset promotes peaceful action all the time. If every entity is dependent on and connected to another, then only beneficial actions and events can lead to better ways of living for all. Recognising and accepting this mindset can help to heal the environmental injuries of the past. Buddhism provides a different approach and atones for the broken relationship between humanity and nature.

When we integrate our beliefs, values and ideas into our behavior, we bring them alive and give them power and influence over the world. But if we see ourselves as separate from the world, it’s easy to dismiss our actions as irrelevant or unlikely to make a difference to the world as a whole.

 

Birds4Laos is a forest installation that explores the theme of integration – how we are connected to nature, to each other. It also deals with ‘anicca’ or impermanence - symbolized in Buddhism by such rituals as the beautiful and colourful sand mandalas that are created by monks, only to be ritualistically destroyed. Representing the Buddhist belief in the transitory nature of material life. Change, therefore is inevitable, forms change due to aging, decay or decomposure. Change is undeniable and truthful to our existence.

 

The installation of Birds4Laos will see one thousand white origami cranes hanging in the Bokeo forest. The Bokeo Forest is a protected nature reserve in northern Laos. White birds appear in many myths and cultures as symbols of peace, happiness and good luck. According to Japanese folklore, cranes can also live for one thousand years.

 

The practice of making one thousand origami paper cranes is also very much tied in with meditation and mindfulness, via the very process of creating the birds whilst simultaneously observing both the ever changing sensations within and the nature of transience itself.

 

This project takes the themes of connectedness and impermanence, to create an installation to hang in the trees. You can become involved in the Birds4Laos piece by dedicating a paper crane. Supporting this project will mean that a beautiful paper crane is hung in the Bokeo forest – with biodegradable materials of course. For $5 a name will be added to a bird. Acting as a memorial to remember those we love and have not forgotten. Because of the impermanent nature of this project, we are reminded of the importance to accept that everything will eventually pass and we should aim to not become attached in a way which causes us suffering. Creating this installation with prior knowledge of its imminent demise is a liberating feeling.

The gradual fading of the birds as they are washed away by rain, or fall naturally acts as a metaphor for life in general.

Images of your birds will be sent to all those who take part.

 

Birds4Laos, then is about nature, impermanence, change, decay, participation.

The temporal nature of these ephemeral birds is where the inherent beauty of the installation lies. We must accept and appreciate that there is no static being; change and movement rule the universe.

Choose the name of a loved one, present or absent. The one thousand birds will become a memorial.

Without needing to adopt a new religion, just recognizing and accepting this mindset we are elevated to a higher level of consciousness which enables us to live in equanimity concerning nature. We must realize that we are not separate from our environment. We are all interrelated and reliant on one another.

 

To get involved and help share the project visit:

Facebook.com/birds4laos

Twitter.com/birds4laos

Birds4laos.wordpress.com

 

Thank You!

campaign_city: Huay Xai, Lao People's Democratic Republic

story:
THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU.

I'm floored, baffled, buffaloed - at the support everyone has shown. This was an incredible experience for me. People are good. I am a lucky girl to be surrounded and followed by so many astoundingly generous pals.

<3 <3 <3 CHEST BUSTIN 24/7 <3 <3 <3

RE: PERKS and PERK DISBURSEMENT:

1. THANK YOU. 
2. I will be drawing and writing and painting throughout my time in Banff, and will hopefully have most of the baking done before I leave. My plan is to get everything to everyone by the end of November. Busy times!!!
3. THANK YOU.

OH PS THANK YOU.

 

 

 

My name is Sarah Adams.

I'm a standup comedian, a visual artist, an ex-pastry chef, and a working single mom of two. I love my family, I love making things, and I love comedy. 

I perform standup, sketch comedy, and improv theatre regularily, and I've opened for the likes of Todd Barry, Neil Hamburger, Tim Heidecker, and Natasha Leggero. I adore the strange pursuit of making others laugh. My comedy activities can be found at www.saraghadams.com. 

Before comedy, I maintained an active visual arts practice - exhibiting and writing about contemporary art within the Canadian art community. Evidence of my visual art activities can easily be found by googling "Sarah Adams-Bacon".

I also ran a cake business for a while. This information is relevant once we get to the "perks" section.

My current focus is on finding a way to meld my comedy pursuits and my art practice together. I'm especially intrigued with how art and comedy relate to one another. Generally speaking, art - on its surface - is quite somber, yet rather absurd at its core. Comedy, inversely, comes across as silly on its exterior, yet is often based in weighted darkness. I'm curious where the two meet. I feel that when they do meet, brilliance occurs. Beauty, sincerity, absurdity, tragedy. Hilarious. Hilarious.

These things considered, I was thrilled when The Banff Centre announced the 24 Experimental Comedy Training Camp, facilitated by Michael Portnoy with guests Mai Abu ElDahab, Steven Johnson, and Reggie Watts. This is exactly what I'd been looking for: a way to actively, intensely consolodate my visual art and comedy practices.

It's a 40-day residency, from September 10 - October 26, 2012. Up until this point, having two young children, residencies have not been something I've been able to participate in. The people I love supported my application to the program, and my mother offered child care assistance. I applied in early spring.

I was accepted. I recieved confirmation just over a month after granting deadlines had passed, however.

Total costs for the program are $5209. Happily, I qualified for 50% funding by The Banff Centre. I am seeking funds to cover the remaining 50%, as well as enough funds to cover 2 months rent while I am away, as I will be away from work during this time.

What I Need

My funding needs are as follows:

  • $2600 - remaining 50% of program tuition
  • $2200 - two months rent while I'm away
  • TOTAL ASK: $4800

What You'll Get

Aside from my undying love and everlasting appreciation, I've listed several great perks. I'll take care of you! Art! Cookies! Cakes! Wonderful things!

Please be sure to watch the video and view the gallery to get a better idea of what I'm offering :)

 

The Impact

1. Up until now, I've never had the chance to develop my art career via formal residencies. Because I've been busy supporting my family, I've passed up several opportunities. This program carries post-secondary accredation and melds my two passions incredibly. This is a valuable chance for me to enrich my career as an artist and a comedian.

2. This residency emphasizes comedy as an art form, and I hope to extend the value of it by taking the theme onto the road afterwards. I want to initiate a cross-Canada experimental comedy tour in the summer of 2013. I will attempt to extend thanks to everyone who contributed to this campaign by performing in your cities.

3. If I'm not able to reach my goal, every contribution still helps me immensely, and all funds will still go towards the residency. I will seek out a loan to cover the remaining funds.

4. If I somehow exceed my goal, all funds beyond $4800 will go directly to my 2013 Canadian experimental comedy tour, and you'll all definitely be seeing me next year!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but would still like to help, please feel free to circulate this campaign among anyone who would be interesed.
